loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business. Marivic has been in this business for 19 years. Marivic earns more income from food vending. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Helen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida works hard to support her family. Leonida is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, milk, sugar, etc. Leonida has been in this business for 36 years now. In the future, Leonida would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sinignesigui 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SINIGNESIGUI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à NIEROUNI un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame KADIATOU débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SINIGNESIGUI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son interêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Sinignesigui 2 group are married women. On average, they are 44 years old and have three children. Most of them live in traditional families in Nierouni, a village in the town of Loulouni, Sikasso Cercle, third administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to see their farming activities through the rainy season. This is their eighth farming loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans were repaid. 

They plant rice with Madame Kadiatou who is standing second from the right in this photo of Sinignesigui 2. With her loan, she will pay for one 50 kg bag of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and plowing for 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, she sells her crops in Sikasso for cash and credit, and to both men and women. She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 73,000 FCFA per season.

Part of these profits will allow her to pay her loan interest. The rest will allow her to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer, plowing, and herbicide.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin es un caficultor del norte del país. Vive en su pequeña finca con su compañera y sus 3 hijos. Muy contento, este pequeño productor dice que en los últimos 3 años la producción de su café ha presentado un incremento desde 200 hasta 350 quintales, 

Para este ciclo él está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permitan darle un adecuado mantenimiento a su cafetal y continuar mejorando los rendimientos y calidad de su café. 

Su sueño es incrementar las áreas productivas de café en los próximos años, y tener una mayor producción para poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones porque está seguro que este rubro tiene un gran potencial económico.
texts.en:
Marvin is a coffee grower in the northern part of the country.  He lives on his small farm with his wife and three children.  This small producer is a cheerful person who says that in the last three years his coffee production has increased from 200 to 350 quintals.

This cycle he is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers so he can provide adequate maintenance for his coffee plantation and continue improving coffee yield and quality.

His dream is to expand coffee production over the coming years to give his family better living conditions.  He is sure the sector has great economic potential.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Rouleen

texts.en: Rouleen is 42 years old, married and has four schooling children. They are currently residing in a rural community. To generate additional income, she offers catering services for any occasion such as weddings, christenings, birthdays and many others. She aims to strengthen this business in order to earn a higher income and support the education of her children. She wants to acquire more stock of the needed materials but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she wants a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock of kitchen utensils and materials needed to provide a better service to her customers. She believes that her loan will help her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of kitchen utensils and materials for catering

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Sur, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es:
Felix es un  hombre trabajador, tiene 53 años y vive en Ica con su esposa y sus 2 hijos por quienes ha trabajado día y noche para poder brindarles un futuro mejor y hacer de ellos personas de bien.
Es una persona ejemplar, porque trabajando honradamente pudo educar a sus hijos, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación; y hoy, siendo ellos profesionales saben agradecer y retribuir todo el amor que él les brindo cuando eran pequeños.
Desde hace más de 5 años realiza servicios de carga en las diversas construcciones que se llevan a cabo en la ciudad donde reside.
Felix está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar electrodomésticos (cocina y refrigeradora) para su hogar, para que su esposa pueda sentirse más segura cocinando y pueda guardar las compras del mercado y evitar que se malogren; de esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felix, 53, is a hard-working man who lives in Ica with his wife and two children, who he works day and night for so they can have a better future and become good citizens.

He is an exemplary person who, through his honest work, was able to give his children an education with much effort and dedication.  Now, they are professionals who know how to appreciate and reciprocate the love their father gave them when they were young.

For over five years, Felix has been working on several construction sites in the city where he lives.  He is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support as he will be able to buy domestic appliances such as a stove and refrigerator for his home.  This will make his wife feel safer while cooking and also giver her a place to store the goods she purchases at the market to avoid spoilage.  This will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a stove and refrigerator for his home.

loans.name: Sinignesigui 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SINIGNESIGUI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à NIEROUNI un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame ALIMATA assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SINIGNESIGUI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  68 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son interêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sinignesigui 3 Group are married women who are, on average 40 years old and have three children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the village of Nierouni, Loulouni commune, Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

During the winter months, the women work to improve their agricultural businesses so they collaborate with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their eighth loan, the previous loans have all been fully and correctly repaid.

Alimata (sitting second from the right in the photo) grows rice.  She plans to use her loan to buy one 50kg sack of fertilizer, one drum of herbicide and pay the labour costs to work half a hectare of land.  She sells her produce in the village in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash or on credit.

Alimata expects to make an average profit of 68,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will enable her to repay her loan and interest, and help her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicides and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun is a hardworking, married man but he has no children. He is 34 years old, and a farmer in Prey Veng Province. He has been doing farming for nearly 10 years and the main source of his income comes from growing and harvesting rice to sell in the local market. In total, he is able to make around USD 5 per day.

Hoeun would like to have enough energy for his household and reduce his monthly expenses by purchasing a solar energy system to install at his home. Due to inadequate funds, he has requested a loan of USD 500 from Kiva through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, Hoeun hopes to have energy to support his household appliances, such as lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him with a special interest rate. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her oldest daughter

loans.name: Progresista Ricaurte Group

texts.es:
En Ricaurte encontramos a ROSI.  Mujer de 47 años que vive actualmente con su esposo y sus 2 ultimas hijas que estudian en la comunidad. Uno de sus hijos en futbolista, una de las hijas mayores es doctora en medicina general y otra de ellas es ingeniera.
Su esposo es empleado de una empresa en Quinindé y se dedica a la reforestación de madera.
ROSI. Viene trabajando con los préstamos de Fodemi desde hace 3 años y nos comenta que ha cambiado de negocios por qué tener  una tienda no era rentable en la localidad. Razón por la cual hoy mantiene el negocio de venta de combustibles de uso doméstico y  automotriz. (Botellas de gas y gasolina por galones.)
Nos comenta haber adquirido los permisos para este negocio y ve que es muy bueno. Porque el producto  no caduca.
En esta ocasión ella recibirá en su préstamo $950,00 dólares con los cuales adquirirá gasolina y gas doméstico para brindar la facilidad de conseguir estos productos a las personas que habitan en la comunidad. Por ser el único lugar en la comunidad que vende estos productos. A ROSI le va muy bien y está contenta con esta institución por la oportunidad que ofrece a la gente pobre de los lugares más apartados transformar su vida a través de sus ideas de negocio y el apoyo económico a través de los créditos de esta institución.
texts.en:
Rosi, 47, lives in Ricaurte with her husband and two youngest daughters who attend school in the community.  One of her sons is a football player, one of her eldest daughters is a general practioner and another is an engineer.  Her husband works at the Quinindé company in reforestation.

Rosi has been receiving loans through the Fodemi insititution for three years and says she decided to change businesses because her store was not profitable.  Now she sells domestic and automobile fuel (bottles of gas and gasoline by the gallon).

She acquired permits for the business which is going very well because the products do not expire.  On this occasion, she will receive a loan of $950 to buy gasoline and domestic gas to sell to people in the community, who have a hard time obtaining these products.

Rosi is doing well and is grateful to the institution for this opportunity which offers people in remote, impoverished areas to transform their lives through their business ideas by supporting them through loans.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and domestic gas to to make available to people who live in the community.

loans.name: Silvestre Giovanni

texts.es:
Silvestre es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Tiene 31 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como chofer de un pequeño vehículo transportando a los pasajeros a diversos destinos de la Ciudad, le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable, honrada y sobre todo porque respeta todas las leyes de tránsito y se preocupa por la seguridad y bienestar de sus pasajeros.
Trabaja incansablemente porque quiere brindar a sus hijos una excelente educación y un mejor futuro.
Silvestre está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una refrigeradora para su hogar para que de esta manera los productos que compra para el consumo diario duren más tiempo, de esta manera podrá elevar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvestre is a person who is very determined to get ahead.  He is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three hcildren in Ica.  For several years he has worked as a driver of a small passenger transport vehicle around the city.  Business is going very well for him since he is responsible, honest and, above all else, respects traffic laws and worries about the safety and well-being of his passengers.

He works tirelessly because he wants to give his children an excellent education and a better future.  Silvestre is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support he will be able to buy a refrigerator for his home to safeguard fresh foods bought for daily consumption.  This will give his household a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for his home.

Sali (standing second from the right in the photo) grows rice.  She plans to use her loan to buy one 50kg sack of fertilizer, one drum of herbicide and pay the labour costs to work half a hectare of land.  She sells her produce in the village in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash or on credit.

Sali expects to earn an average profit of 73,000 francs CFA over the loan period, which she will use to repay her loan and interest, and help her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.name: Cronelyn

texts.en:
Cronelyn is 18 and studying in the university here in Misamis Occidental. She used her previous loan to pay for tuition fees and study materials for the previous school year. 

Cronelyn is always focused on her studies because she wants to help her parents and, aside from that, she is hoping to work in a company in town or abroad if given a chance.  This will provide for more comfortable and better living conditions in the near future. Recently, she took a new loan to pay the costs of tuition fees for the semester.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the semester

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María tiene 63 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su esposo y se dedica al comercio de productos de tienda como: golosinas, pan dulce, arroz, frijoles, aceite, detergente, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Su negocio es muy importante dado que es lo que le permite ajustar para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus negocio ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mercadería como: frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, detergentes y de más artículos demandados por los clientes. Espera poder aumentar las ventas y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 63, lives in her own home with her husband.  She has a store where she sells sweets, bread, rice, beans, oil, detergent, etc.  This is how she earns a living and supports the household.  Her business is very important since it is what allows her to cover household expenses.

In an effort to improve business she has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to buy goods such as beans, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, detergents and other items requested by her customers.  This will increase sales and provide a better income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beans, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, oil, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie owns and manages a pottery manufacturing business, making and selling assorted pots. She has been doing this business for six years and it helps her family as well as the workers in her business. She had successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for financing the business. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy more pots. She hopes to expand and improve her business to improve her standard of living and be able to provide work in her community.

loans.use: to buy more pots

loans.name: Feleciano

texts.en: Feleciano is running a fishing business to earn a living and his wife works as a lady guard. He has been fishing for more than 11 years, earning a good enough income to provide for the family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used for acquiring fishing material. To buy new fishing nets, he took a new loan recently. He is hopeful that, in the future, he will acquire a fishing boat to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Yiriwaton 1 Group

texts.fr:

loans.name: Chreng

texts.en:
Chreng is 31 years old and a married woman. She grows and harvests rice to sell at market in a region of Preah Sdach District, Prey Veng Province. Farming is the work that she has done since she was a young girl living with her parents. Together with her husband, they manage their own farm as it is the sole source of income for the family. 

This will be her first loan. Chreng will use it to buy a solar panel home system to install on the roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. By being with Hattha Kaksekar Limited, she can gain access to micro-finance services and solar energy, which she uses to support household appliances such as lights, TV, and radio, so everyone in his family can even work or study at night. She expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to pay for a solar power system.

loans.name: Yiriwaton 3 Group

texts.fr:

Mafoune expects to earn an average profit of 61,000 francs CFA over the loan period, which she will use to repay her loan and interest, and help her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Yiriwaton 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe  YIRIWATON 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à SENINA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame MAWA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  YIRIWATON 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  85 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son interêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Yiriwaton 4 Group are married women who are, on average, 42 years old and have five children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the village of Senina, Loulouni commune, Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).  

During the winter months, the women work to improve their agricultural businesses, so they collaborate with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their tenth loan, the previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Mawa (standing on the left in the photo) grows rice.  She plans to use her loan to buy two 50kg sacks of fertilizer, two drums of herbicide and pay the labour costs to work half a hectare of land.  She sells her produce in the village in Sikasso, to both men and women, on a cash or credit basis.

Mawa expects to earn an average profit of 85,000 francs CFA over the loan period, which she will use to repay her loan and interest, and help her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with three children. She operates a fish vending business together with her husband to earn a living. For more than fifteen years that they have been running the business, they have earned well for the family. She has one dependent as two of her children are already married. 

She successfully repaid her previous loans used for the business. She is interested to improve her vending business. For this reason, she recently took a new loan to buy a styrofoam chest to use to keep fish for sale.  In the future, she wants to build a concrete home for her family.

loans.use: to buy a styrofoam chest to keep fish for sale.

loans.name: Jd Ace

texts.en:
JD Ace is studying at Misamis University of Science and Technology. He is single and lives in Oroquieta City with his family. His father is a businessman and his mother worked as a teacher. He was determined and wants to finish his studies to have a bright future of his own.  He is thankful to GDMPC that gives every student a chance to continue studying with their services specialized for students. 

He took a new loan recently to pay for the school tuition fees for the first semester for this current year.  He hopes to become successful and be able to have a good job that he likes.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.name: Bayarnyam

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarnyam is a married borrower from Uvs province of Mongolia. She lives with her husband and her 2 children in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, on a rented plot of land. Her husband has been working for almost 3 years, as a guard at the Central Pharmacy. 

Besides importing clothing from China, Er Lian, she wants to have her own business. Due to the summer season she wants to import less clothing from China. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase some seasonal clothing from China, Er Lian to provide affordable yet fashionable clothing to local residents.

loans.use: to purchase some seasonal clothing from China, Er Lian to provide affordable yet fashionable clothing to local residents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mini van so that her husband can provide inter-province public transportation.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, who is 39-year-old single lady, lives in a remote area of Prasat Bakong District, Siem Reap Province. To make a living and survive, Kim feeds pigs and cows to sells to the local dealers. She has been involved in this business for almost 6 years and totally she can make USD 10 a day.

Recently, Kim has applied for a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank, for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program, with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Kim is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy, who is 48-year-old and a lovely mother of three unmarried children, lives in a remote area of Prasat Bakong District, Siem Reap Province. To make a living and survive, she feeds pigs to sell to the local dealers and invests in a farming business. Her husband, Theang, works as a car diver. This couple is able to earn USD 8.50 in one day.

Recently Chanthy has applied for a loan, which is the first time for her, to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank, for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program, with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Chanthy is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 54 years old and married with two children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like detergent, sugar, seasonings and other groceries.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Arlene aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like detergent, sugar, seasonings and other groceries.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is 62 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Willy is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Willy has been farming bananas for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 60 years old and widowed with eight children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Elena has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from fishing.

Elena aspires to save enough money to provide for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 52 years old and has six children. Catalina is married and has one child who is still in school.

Catalina is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Catalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Catalina has been farming bananas for 15 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 49 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming banana in the Philippines. Elvira is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elvira has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Harline

texts.en:
Harline is 33 years old and has two children. Harline is married and has two children who are in school.

Harline is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Harline requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Harline has been raising livestock for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Harline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz works hard to support her family. Luz is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Luz requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Luz has been in this business for 20 years now.

Luz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Eliza works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening.  Eliza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as noodles, shampoo, sugar and other groceries for her general store business.

Eliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like noodles, shampoo, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 32 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Flordeliza works very hard to provide for them.

Flordeliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like detergent soap, canned goods, sanitary pads, shampoo, biscuits, candies, etc. to sell.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, canned goods, sanitary pads, shampoo, biscuits, candies, etc. 

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like detergent soap, canned goods, sanitary pads, shampoo, biscuits, candies to sell.

loans.name: Sinignessigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOUGOULA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec madame MADIARA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme   SINIGNESSIGUI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sinignessigui 1 group are married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have five children. They mostly live in traditional families in Lobougoula, an area in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group is collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Madiara, standing second from the left in the photo, grows corn. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and two drums of herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor to farm a 1/2 hectare of land.

After the harvest crops will be sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Madiara hopes to earn an average profit of 105,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Sinignessigui 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOUGOULA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwo, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec madame KOROTOUMOU assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme   SINIGNESSIGUI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sinignessigui 2 group are married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have four children. They mostly live in traditional families in Lobougoula, an area of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group members are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Korotoumou, seated second from the left in the photo, grows corn. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and two drums of herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor to farm a 1/2 hectare of land. 

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Korotoumou hopes to earn an average profit of 105,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Sinignessigui 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOUGOULA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec madame DJENEBOU assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme   SINIGNESSIGUI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Sinignessigui 3 group are married women who, on average, are 36 years old and have four children. They mostly live in traditional families in Lobougoula, an area in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Djenebou, seated first from the right in the photo, grows corn. With her loan she plans to buy one 50-kilogram sac of fertilizer and one drum of herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor to farm a 1/4 hectare of land. 

After the harvest crops will be sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit. 

Djenebou hopes to earn an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Malia Losa

texts.en:
Malia is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small fishing business to earn a living in her community and has been doing this for 6 years. 

Malia has requested a loan to buy a new boat motor, flippers, a spear, fishing rods and goggles. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Malia will help out with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new boat motor, flippers, a spear, fishing rods and goggles.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is happily married to Edwin. They are blessed with four children. Nancy serves as a housewife while Edwin works as liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) retailer. His income ranges from PHP 10,000 to PHP 15,000 per month. 

As a mother, Nancy wants her youngest child to finish her college studies thus she opted to borrow loan of PHP 200,000 from Kiva lenders through ASKI. Her child’s name is Wincy. 

Wincy is an intelligent and hardworking student. She dreams of designing and building a house for her family, thus she wants to be an engineer someday. Wincy wants to finish her college education for she is determined to pay back the debts of her parents and give them the things they deserve. With that Wincy is very positive that the kind-hearted lenders will grant their loan request.

loans.use: To pay for her eldest child's tuition fees.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 61 years old and married with four children.

Irene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Irene has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Irene aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlinda is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Arlinda has a candle-making business in the Philippines. Arlinda requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Arlinda has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Arlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a Kiva borrower. She has 7 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 27 years. She describes herself as passionate. She operates a retail business where she sells cloth. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are frequent. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cloth. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have frequent cash flow and a good lifestyle. The client will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and will save the rest.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cloth.

loans.name: Saodatkhon

texts.ru: Саодатхон верная жена и заботливая мать троих детей. Она родом из района Кубадиён. Ей 31 год. Саодатхон работает учительницей в средней школе района. У нее высшее образование. Ей нравится учить детей. Одновременно Саодатхон при дворе своего дома выращивает скот для продажи. Этой деятельностью она занимается с помощью мужа в течение 2 лет. Саодатхон берет кредит, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота и за счет прибыли с деятельности улучшить условия быта. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Saodatkhon is a faithful wife and loving mother of three children. She is a native of the Qubadiyon region. She is 31 years old. Saodatkhon works as a teacher at a regional secondary school. She has higher education. She likes to teach children. 

At the same time, Saodatkhon breeds cattle for sale in the yard of her house. She has worked with this business for a period of 2 years, with the help of her husband. Saodatkhon takes a loan in order to increase the number of cattle, and increase her living conditions due to the income from increasing her business. She hopes for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les 3 membres du groupe  SORO YIRIWA sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOUGOULA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur troisième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur SALIA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme SORO YIRIWA . 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 12 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 20 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 230 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The three members of the Soro Yiriwa group are married men who, on average, are 32 years old and have five children. They mostly live in traditional families in Lobougoula, an area of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan, and their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Salia, standing in the middle of the photo, grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy 12 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and 20 drums of different herbicides, and to pay the cost of labor to farm three hectares of land. 

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Salia hopes to earn an average profit of 230,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow him to pay back his part of the loan and its interest as well as to help cover his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 57 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn applied for a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Evelyn has been raising pigs for five years and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en: Agustina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Agustina is 45 years old. Three of her children are currently in school. Agustina has a native basket weaving business in the Philippines. Agustina applied for a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business. Agustina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Agustina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her basket-weaving business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 50 years old and has two children. She is married and her children are in school. Gloria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Gloria has been raising pigs for ten years  and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Andressa

texts.en: Andressa works hard to support her family. Andressa is married and has a business buying and selling bamboo in the Philippines. Andressa applied for a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bamboo to sell. Andressa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Andressa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Dufashanye Group

texts.fr:
Josélyne  fait partie du groupe Dufashanye  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 43 ans et est mariée à  Aster,  un pasteur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants.

Elle  fait le commerce des habits  depuis  7 ans. 

Elle est à son vingt-deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Josélyne is a member of the Dufashanye group and lives in Gitega. She is 43 years old and is married to an Aster, a shepherd. Together they have four children.

Josélyne has been selling clothing for seven years. 

She is on her 22nd loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy a lot of clothing, which she will resell and earn more.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 23-year-old woman who is single with one child. She has a small tailoring business to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. 

Helen needs a loan to buy thread, material, needles, measuring tape, hangers and a new sewing machine. She will use her profits to pay for her child's education. Helen joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy thread, material, needles, measuring tape, hangers and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 46 years old and married with two children, both of them are in school.

Lina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like biscuits, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries.

Lina has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Alejandra works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Alejandra is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, etc for her restaurant business.

Alejandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for the taxi.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 55 years old, a businesswoman from Mahayag. She is a farmer who plants palay and corn.

Mercedita wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. 

She hopes to sustain her farming activities so she could continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 24-year-old unwed woman with one child. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living; she has been doing this for two years. 

Grace has requested a loan to buy material, thread, needles, zippers, measuring tape and a new sewing machine. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, needles, zippers, measuring tape and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 45 years old, and has three children who are currently in school.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 16 years.  Bonifacia has successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Bonifacia requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

In the future, Bonifacia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Erly

texts.en:
Erly works hard to support her family. Erly is married and has a business selling firewood in the Philippines.

Erly requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

Erly has been in this business for 6 years now.

Erly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
A loan of $800 is offered to Belina to improve her business. She has a second hand store where many people come to buy every day.

Belina will buy some additional supplies such as shirts, trousers, and shorts.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Belina independent, because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy short and long sleeved shirts, trousers, and shorts

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy a variety of fresh fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 20 years; she earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fresh fish to sell

loans.name: María Reyna

texts.es: María tiene 63 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija y una nieta. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se gana la vida por medio de la elaboración y venta de pan dulce y francés. Tiene mucho tiempo de contar con el negocio y ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Con el deseo de mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: arroz, azúcar, harina, canela, mantequilla, etc. De esta forma espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old and she lives in her own home together with her daughter and a granddaughter. She is a very hardworking woman who makes her living making and selling sweet breads and French bread. She has been running the business for a long time and has a lot of experience and customers who prefer her every day more.

Keen to increase her income, María has taken the decision to seek this loan from Fusai to invest in her business to buy the necessary supplies such as rice, sugar, flour, cinnamon, butter and so on. In this manner, she hopes to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, cinnamon, butter and so on.

loans.name: Heljember Mauricio

texts.es: Heljember trabaja como ramplero en el aeropuerto de Managua, es un joven de 34 años de edad que junto a su esposa lucha a diario para progresar en la vida, el espera tener sus hijos muy pronto y agrandar la familia, mientras esto llega se está preparando para mejorar las condiciones de su humilde hogar haciendo cambio de techo el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones, solicita el crédito para apoyarse económicamente para comprar los materiales que ocupara para dicha obra.
texts.en: Heljember works as a driver at Managua airport.  He is a young man of 34 who, along with his wife, works hard each day to make progress in life. He hopes to have children very soon and extend his family.  At the same time, he is planning to improve the state of his modest home by replacing the roof which is in a bad condition.  He is seeking a loan to provide economic support which will enable him to buy the materials he needs to carry out this work.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting and purlins.

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
María Aurora tiene 61 años de edad, de estado civil separada, vive con su hija y 2 nietas, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza María es la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, su bodega está ubicada en su domicilio lo que le facilita atender a sus clientes y velar por su familia, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes como arroz, azúcar, leche y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Aurora is 61 years old, separated, and lives with her daughter and 2 grandchildren in a small community in the rural area of Cayaltí. The people there work as farmers, in business, and with livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.
María works selling staple goods. Her grocery store is located in her home, which enables her to serve her customers and look after her family. She has requested a loan of $450 from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a variety of products to offer to her customers such as: rice, sugar, and milk. This will help her to grow her business and to be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Fe Melchorita

texts.en:
Fe is a businesswoman from Mahayag. She is 41 years old and is very responsible with her household obligations. She currently lives with her husband and two children. She is a farmer who plants palay.

Fe signed up for membership with PMPC for the opportunity to access insurances and capitalization. Now, she has requested a loan to buy farm inputs and fertilizer. Fe wants to increase sales. With PMPC as her financing partner, she has no doubts that she will sustain her business and be able to provide well for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 33 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emerlyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Emerlyn has been raising pigs for 9 years now, and has borrowed 32 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emerlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her livestocks

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 48 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, candies, biscuits, canned goods and cooking oil to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, candies, biscuits, canned goods and cooking oil. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like noodles, candies, biscuits, canned goods and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 56 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Fe has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Fe aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar.

loans.name: Lira

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lira works hard to support her family.

She has a food market business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Lira is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Lira has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Conchacalla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE CONCHACALLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Toribia ella es conviviente tiene 02 hijos y tiene 41 años; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan y en las diferentes ferias que se realizan por la zona, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes para su negocio.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de construcción, negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ganaderia,agricultura y negocio de venta de chicha.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Santa Rosa de Lima de Conchacalla” communal bank, this bank is located in the district of Anta, it belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

The member is Toribia who is in a couple and has two children and is 41 years old. She spends her days rearing animals, she rears these little animals to then sell to the customers who request them, as well as in the various fairs held in the area, Toribia dreams of being able to continue working in this manner and continue to support her family. Toribia is seeking the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. 

The other members work in the sale of animals, the construction industry, grocery stores, cattle rearing, farming and the sale of chicha (corn liquor). Toribia thanks those who form part of this dream through this means and pledges to meet the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en:
Fenumiai is 60 years old and married, with 8 children.  For 14 years she  has owned and operated a small store, selling a variety of items.  

Fenumiai needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, a new display fridge, soft drinks, bags of flour, rice, salt, and sugar.  She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her home.  She became a member of SPBD in 2003 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, a new display fridge, soft drinks, bags of flour, rice, salt, and sugar.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria has a farm in Mahayag, Philippines, from which she earns income for the family.  At the age of  66, she busies herself managing her business with her husband.  She has focused her farming activities planting palay and corn.

Recently, Macaria applied for a loan to pay for land preparation.  She has prepared her land for this crop season, and hopes to have a good harvest and to remain a member in good standing with the cooperative.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermín tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en el Distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural donde la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, pollos, gallinas, cerdos, desde hace más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, su esposa le apoya en esta labor para contribuir con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
56 year old Fermín is married, has 1 son, and lives with his family in the district of Oyotún in a rural area where people work as farmers, in business, and with livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.
He works raising and selling animals such as chickens, roosters, and pigs, and has more than 5 years of experience in this business. His wife helps him with this work to contribute to covering the family expenses. He has requested a loan of $900 from Edpyme Alternativa to buy small animals to fatten them and sell them later for a better price.

loans.use: To buy small animals to fatten and then sell at a better price.

loans.name: Julio Gianmarco

texts.es:
Gianmarco tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres en una comunidad grande en el Distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en mototaxi, desde hace más de 2 años, en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para mantenimiento de su vehículo con la compra de aceites, repuestos entre otros y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gianmarco is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents in a large community in the district of Zaña where people work as farmers, in business, and with livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.
He works offering transportation services in his mototaxi and has been doing this for more than 2 years. He has requested a loan of $550 from Edpyme Alternativa to buy spare parts and oil to maintain his vehicle and so to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and oil to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Norma Roxana

texts.es:
Norma Roxana tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto sus hijos y esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, pavos y cuyes, los alimenta con granos naturales de la zona y alimentos balanceados que ayudan en su crecimiento, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales que le permitirán generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Norma Roxana is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and lives in her own home along with her partner and children. She lives in the district of Cayaltí, a community where people work in agriculture, business, and with livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region of the north coast of Perú.
She works raising and selling small animals such as chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs. She feeds them on natural grains from the region and commercial animal feed that helps with their growth. She has requested a loan of $725 from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a greater quantity of animals so that she can generate greater income.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals so she can generate more income.

loans.name: Wildor

texts.es:
Wildor tiene 34 años de edad, tiene hogar estable, junto a su conyugue y sus 5 menores hijos, reside en su casa propia casa en el caserío de Cabra chica, una zona rural del Distrito de Pucará una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, ubicado en el caserío de Cabra chica, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Wildor, who is 34, has a stable home with his wife and 5 young children.  He lives in his own home in the village of Cabra Chica, which is a rural area in the Pucará district.  In this area of Jaén province, in the Cajamarca region on Peru's north coast, the people work in agriculture, trade and cattle rearing.
Wildor works in agriculture, growing pineapples in particular, in the village of Cabra Chica and has 10 years' experience behind him.  He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy plant-sanitation products and fertiliser and to pay workers to do the harvest. As a result, his crop will benefit physiologically, morphologically and productively and this will lead to a higher yield, a better quality product and he will therefore have no problem in selling his produce.

loans.use: to buy plant-sanitation products and fertilisers and to pay workers to harvest his coffee.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines for 10 years now.  Gloria requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional seed and fertilizers for her farm.  To help sustain the farm, she has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Sara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sara tiene 42 años de edad  de estado civil soltera vive con sus hijos de 7 y 17 años en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo  se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma ciudad y que se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Sara se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es aumentar la siembra y comprarse una casa. Su desafío es las enfermedades en los sembríos. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
42 year old Sara is single and lives with her sons who are 7 and 17 years old in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos. 
She is a member of the community bank Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo, which is located in the city of Pueblo Viejo. It is comprised of 10 members who are from the same city and who work in farming and with livestock.
Sara works as a farmer and grows corn. She is requesting this loan to buy manure, insecticide, fertilizer, and fungicide. She will buy these in Ventanas. Her goals is to increase her harvest and buy a house. Her challenges is that the crops get diseases. In her free time, she likes to watch TV.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Panglan Indah Group

texts.en:
Finally, the Panglan Indah group was able to pay off its loan on time. During the past six months, the group succeed in looking after their pigs. Ni Nyoman is the head of the group and the one responsible for the repayment. She maintained three fattening pigs and sold them. After deducting the cost of feed and the price of piglets, she earned a satisfactory profit. She’s very happy for that, and she hopes that with the next loan she will get more profit to improve her business.

Panglan Indah group is located in the middle part Bali; most of them are involved in farming. All the husbands of the members of the Panglan Indah group work as farmers and as a Balinese woman, they also support the husband's income by raising pigs at home.

After successfully paying off the first loans, they are proceeding to the next period with a purpose to improving their businesses. And they also make some changes in the group member and the rules. 

Ni Nyoman is head of the group and coordinates the purchase of piglets so that all members get good piglets. With the loan, she bought three local piglets that become pig barbeque (“Babi Guling” in Bahasa) that are sold every 2 months. From the results of this effort, she plans to save for her children's educational needs.

loans.use: to buy three local piglets.

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LUCERO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dominga ella es casada tiene 43 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.  
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz, leche entre otros.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de vino, tienda de abarrotes, carpintería y socios que trabajan en empresas privadas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Lucero” communal bank, this bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province and department of Cusco. The member in question is Dominga, she is married, is 43 years old and has four children.

Dominga spends her days working in a grocery store. She has been working in this business for years and it has been going well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day. She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk and so on. She wants to be able to continue working to continue supporting her family in this manner. 

Dominga is seeking the loan to buy merchandise such as rice, milk and so on. The other members make their living in wine sales, grocery store, carpentry and members who work in private companies. The members who appear in the attached photos requested permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons. Dominga is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this mean and pledges to meet the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchanidse such as rice, milk and other goods.

loans.name: Angel Julian

texts.es:
Angel es un joven de 22 años de edad, vive en Chincha con su conviviente y su pequeño hijo.
Él quiere lo mejor para su familia es por ello que siempre ha luchado para sacarlos adelante. Actualmente trabaja como Operario en una reconocida empresa Avícola de la Ciudad donde vive.
Es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora. Una de sus mayores metas es poder construir su casa para que su hijito pueda tener un lugar seguro para poder vivir.
Angel está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar su vivienda, así como las paredes, techo, piso y la puerta que está un poco deteriorada, de esa manera podrá brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia y cada día irá a trabajar más tranquilo, con la certeza que su familia se encuentra en un ambiente con todas las comodidades y seguro.
texts.en:
Angel is a young man of 22 years old, he lives in Chincha with his partner and their young son. He wants the best for his family which is why he has always fought to get them ahead in life. He currently works in a well-known poultry company in the city in which he lives.

Angel is a very responsible and hardworking person. One of his biggest goals is to be able to build his home so that his son can have a safe place to live. 

Angel is grateful to the Kiva loan lenders because with the help that they have given him, he will be able to remodel his home: the walls, roof, floor and door which are damaged. In this way, Angel will be able to give his family a greater level of safety and every day he will go to work with a light heart with the certainty that his family is in an environment that has all the commodities and is safe.

loans.use: to remodel the walls, roof, floor and door to his home.

loans.name: Bankito La Ramada  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nuevo Bankito La Ramada está formado por 16 mujeres y 1 hombre quienes viven en una comunidad perteneciente al cantón Nabón, lugar de clima frió. Todas las personas del sector aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, es su identidad, en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales, muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca y por las noches se regresan a sus hogares.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, es una socia amable que se encuentra  desde hace 3 años en el grupo de crédito Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, este grupo le ha permitido estrechar los lasos de amistad con cada una de las socias y los créditos le benefician en su pequeño negocio.
La Señora María  tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido  4 hijos de 7, 5, 3 años y su ultimo hijo de apenas 7 meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos se estudian en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que viven es  propia.
Doña María se dedica a las tareas de la casa y al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para ayudarle económicamente  a su esposo cría ganado, cerdos, pollos y cuyes que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es tener más animales y de mejor calidad.
texts.en: The Nuevo Bankito La Ramada credit group is made up of 16 women and 1 man who live in a village in the canton of Nabón, a place with a cold climate. All the local residents still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages because these are a part of their identity. Most of them work in agriculture or animal breeding and many go to work in the city of Cuenca, returning home at night. One of the group's members is María, a cheerful member who has belonged to the Nuevo Bankito La Ramada credit group for 3 years. As a member of the group, she has been able to develop friendships with all the members and the loans she receives help her to run her small business. María is 33 and is married with 4 children, aged 7, 5 and 3 years and a baby who is just 7 months old. Her two elder children go to a local primary school.  Her husband works as a labourer and they own their own home.
