María does the household chores and looks after the children but, to help her husband financially, she breeds livestock, pigs, chickens and guinea pigs which she sells when she needs something. She is going to use the loan to buy pigs and animal feed.  Her goal is to have more animals of better quality.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 57 years old. She is married with one child and is a resident of San Jose, Mahayag. 

Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in 2008 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 15,000 PHP to purchase inventories of canned goods, sugar and milk.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her child finish his studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of canned goods, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Fidelin

texts.en:
Fidelin is 32 years old and has two children. Fidelin is married and has two children who are in school.

Fidelin is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Fidelin requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Fidelin has been in pig-fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Fidelin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is applying for a loan of $700 to improve her business. She is running a business in her house selling diesel and gasoline. She is making a good income from selling diesel and gasoline.

She wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her business a year ago with her working capital of $600.

loans.use: To buy diesel and gasoline.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Gemma is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell in her charcoal business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Digna Patricia

texts.es:
Digna tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil soltero vive con su hijo y conviviente en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo  se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma ciudad y que se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Digna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, y al engorde de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es tener un buen negocio. Su desafío es contar con un negocio propio. En su tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en: 25-year-old Digna is not married but lives with her son and partner in the province of Ventanas in Los Ríos province. She is a member of the Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo solidarity group which is based in the city of Pueblo Viejo.  The group is made up of 10 members who come from the same city and who all work in farming or livestock breeding. Digna grows corn and fattens pigs. She is applying for this loan to cover the cost of agricultural supplies which she will buy in Ventanas. Her goal is to have a successful business and she has to face the challenge of running her own business. In her free time she enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser

loans.name: Taravat

texts.en:
Taravat is a 39-year-old married woman. She has two daughters and her husband is a laborer. 

Taravat has a small garden and raises flowers and trees there and sells them. She has been working in this area for 12 years and her monthly income is 390 AZN.
 
Azerbaijan people love nature very much. They like to make a green corner in their houses and flats. They build gardens and raise beautiful plants and trees. Taravat knows this and sells flowers, plants and young trees at local bazaars.
 
Taravat loves her job very much but her income doesn’t cover the family’s demands. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy quality fertilizers and garden tools. She wants to make her garden bigger and increase the assortment of plants and trees. This will increase her income and help her to provide her family.

loans.use: to buy quality fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Maximo Alejandro

texts.es:
Maximo tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus hijas de 7 y 17 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo  se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma ciudad y que se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Maximo se dedica a la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes e insecticidas. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es incrementar su negocio y construir una casa propia. Su desafío es las enfermedades en los cultivos. En su tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Maximo, 43, is single and lives with his daughters ages 7 and 17 in the Ventanas Canton of the Los Rios Province.

He is a member of the Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo communal bank, which is in the in the city of Pueblo Viejo. The group is comprised of 10 members from the same city who work in agriculture and cattle raising.

Maximo works in agriculture. He is requesting a loan to buy manure, fertilizer, and insecticide. He will make his purchases in Ventanas. His goal is to increase his business and build his own home. His challenge is diseases in his crops. In his free time, he likes to go for walks and play sports.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Maa Kantajuren Group

texts.en:
Maa Kantajuren Self-Help Group (SHG) was formed in March 2014. It consists of 11 rural poor women members who live below the poverty line. This group is located in a remote rural village named Phursund of Nuapada district of Odisha, India. Most of the households of this village are potters and cultivators. Tejkanti is one of the members of this group. She belongs to a potter community whose traditional business was making earthen pots. But these days many families have given up this work and are adopting other sources of income. 

The lady sitting second from right with raised hand in the photo is Tejkanti. She is a very active lady of 31 years age. She lives with her husband, one son of 9 years and two daughters of 14 and 4 years. Her elder son and daughter are continuing their study in the local school.

Tejkanti has a vegetable cultivation farm. She and her husband manage the farm. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrot, cabbage, chili, cucumber, papaya, ladyfinger, onion, etc. in the farm. She sells her products to the traders of the nearest town who come to take vegetables from her farm. Her husband also goes to markets to sell the products. 

Tejkanti says that she earns a minimum of 5,000 INR per month from this business, which is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family, farm expenses and the educational expenses of her children. Although she has more land for cultivation, due to lack of funds, she is not able to cultivate it. 

Therefore Tejkanti wants to expand her business by taking a loan of 16,000 INR from Mahashakti Foundation. She is planning to use the present loan to buy a water pump, fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. Tejkanti hopes to construct a house and educate her children to lead a respectable life. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work. 

The other ten members of this group are involved in businesses like vegetable cultivation, cycle mart, general grocery shop and vegetable vending.

loans.use: Tp pay for purchasing a water pump, fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. Liberty has been in this business for 20 years, and she earns additional income from retailing pre-paid mobile loads.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Liberty has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Bahlul

texts.en:
Bahlul is a master builder, he makes iron doors and windows to order. He has been in this business for 15 years. During these years, he gained enough experience in his job and moved forward in it. Now he has lot of customers. 

In the past, Bahlul borrowed a loan from Kiva, and it has helped to improve Bahlul’s business. Today he needs Kiva’s help again, and for this reason Bahlul has applied for a 1,200-AZN( Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy necessary tools. 

He says, “Thanks dear Kiva organization and lenders for help. I am thankful.”  

Bahlul is a married man and father of three children. His elder son, who is 20 years old, and studies at school. Both of his other children are going to secondary school. The family has been living in Ahmadbayli village for over 20 years.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and married. She lives in Mahayag. She has a farm where she earns her living. Teresita has signed up her membership with PMPC for access to insurance and capital.

She has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer. Teresita hopes to continue to provide for her family, especially the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 18 years old and has one child. Due to financial hardships, she is engaged in buying and reselling various vegetables within her community to help her husband in generating income. She aims to continue and improve her business in order to sustain their necessities and save for future emergencies. 

Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of petchay, eggplants, squash, beans, okra, tomatoes, carrots, and more vegetables to sell. Being patient and industrious, she believes that she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of petchay, eggplants, squash, beans, okra, tomatoes, carrots, and more vegetables to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Sur, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 41 years old, married, and has six children.

She earns a living by a restaurant business in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa has been in the restaurant business for 15 years.

Ma. Theresa is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, eggs, canned goods, etc.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Janet has been in this business for three years now.

Janet requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 31 years old and married. She has five children, and three of them are currently in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Helen has been in pig fattening for two years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  

Helen requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with eight school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, bread, and maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, bread, and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Durdana

texts.en:
Durdana is 55 years old married with two sons.  Her husband is a farmer and breeds two cows but the main source of her family’s income is gardening. 

Durdana has been raising and selling seasonal fruits (apples, pears, peaches, quince, etc.) and vegetables (cucumber, potatoes, tomatoes) for 17 years.  She has good skills and her monthly income is 260AZN.

There is a high demand for fruits and vegetables in Azerbaijan. They use fresh fruits to make juice, pies and jam, and vegetables to cook delicious national dishes. 

Durdana is very responsible woman.  She does everything for her family and works hard.  Durdana needs money in to provide high education for her children. 

She applied for 1500AZN loan in order to buy fertilizers and build greenhouse. This will increase her productivity and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and build greenhouse.

loans.name: Walegnoumadon 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe  WALEGNOUMADON 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOUGOULA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec madame FANTA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme    WALEGNOUMADON 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the Walegnoumadon 1 group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have five children. They mostly live in traditional families in Lobougoula, an area of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Fanta, standing first from the left in the photo, grows corn. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and two drums of herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor to farm a 1/2 hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Fanta hopes to earn an average profit of 105,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband take care of the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Walegnoumadon 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe  WALEGNOUMADON 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOUGOULA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec madame AMINATA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  WALEGNOUMADON 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The four members of the Walegnoumadon 2 group are married women who, on average, are 43 years old and have five children. They mostly live in traditional families in Lobougoula, one of the areas in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Aminata, standing second from the left in the photo, grows corn. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and two drums of herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor to farm a 1/2 hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Aminata hopes to earn an average profit of 105,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Joselinda

texts.en:
Joselinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her business.

Joselinda has been in this business for eight years.  She also earns income from pig fattening.

Joselinda has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Precy works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline.  

Precy is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Precy has sustained her business because of five past loans from NWTF.   

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 25, is married with two children.  They reside in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province.  All of her children are too young to attend school. 

To support the family, Mao and her husband have farmed rice for several years.  Together, they earn about KHR33,000 per day and save about KHR15,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the first micro loan for Mao with VisionFund.  She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.  She hopes to make more income from her current business. 

Mao hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice and sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut heads the Sri Cendana group.  She has a sow and will use her portion of the loans to purchase high quality feed and piglets.  

Ni Ketut hopes the sow can birth safely and the piglets can grow healthy.    

In the past, Ni Ketut has sold her piglets after keep them for two months at a satisfactory price.  Ni Ketut sells piglets for fattening or pig barbeque purposes.

Ni Ketut has managed her previous loans wisely.  Repayment have been done on time. 

Ni Ketut is very grateful for the benefits she earned and she thanked lenders for their support.

The Sri Cendana group has received seven previous loans from MUK.  The group anticipates an increased loan amount per member because one of its members resign from the group.

Ni Ketut has a plan to save all profits for use by her business later.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feed and piglets.

loans.name: Enerio

texts.en:
Enerio is a farmer in Mahayag.  He is 41 years old and has always been known to provided the best for his family. 

Enerio wants to increase his sales. Consequently, he requested a loan that to cover the cost of land preparation and to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items.

Enerio works to keep bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to prepare land and purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina, 45, is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Magdalina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase vaccines, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Magdalina has been raising pigs for seven years and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Magdalina would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Juliana requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Juliana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en:
Beverlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Beverlyn has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Beverlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Andres Isidoro

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa e hijos de 12 y 11 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo  se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma ciudad y que se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Andrés se dedica a la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos agrícolas para la siembra de arroz. Su meta es incrementar su negocio. Su desafío es las enfermedades en sus cultivos. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Andrés is 39 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children, who are 12 and 11 years old, in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province.

He is a member of the Ciudad de Pueblo Viejo Communal Bank, which is located in the city of Pueblo Viejo. The bank is made up of 10 members from the same city who are engaged in farming and livestock raising.

Andrés is a farmer. He is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies to plant rice. His goal is to increase his business. His challenge is crop disease. In his free time he enjoys playing sports and watching television.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past three years she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn, 54, is single and residing in a rural village located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 15 years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sokhorn has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokhorn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops so as to be better off in her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Dúo Exitosas Group

texts.es: Dúo Exitosas, este grupo esta formado por la señora Zoila de 24 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles desde hace varios años,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles, ya que sus clientes han aumentado y no tiene suficiente capital para surtirles lo que le piden de productos comestibles, el sueño de ella es tener una tienda mas grande para generar mejores ganancias
texts.en: Señora Zoila, age 24, is one half of Dúo Exitosas [The Successful Duo], and has run a grocery store for several years. She is applying for a loan to purchase additional inventory because her customer base is growing. Señora Zoila she lacks the capital to meet customer demand for the food items she sells. She aspires to have a larger store that would allow her to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase food items to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres Virtuosas este grupo esta formado por la señora Maria Emiliana de 41 año de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, ya que es la unica forma que ella tiene para ayudar a su familia, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica para la venta,esperando que le puedan ayudar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo Mujeres Virtuosas is a duo of which Sra. Maria Emiliana is a member. She is 41 years old and is dedicated to selling traditional clothing. She has been engaged in this business for several years because it is the only way she has to help her family.

At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase traditional clothing to sell. She hopes you can help her with her business.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita finds joy doing farming in Mahayag. She is 49 years old and is a farmer who plants palsy and corn.

Nenita is a microfinance member of PMPC who has taken previous loans and has religiously paid her obligations without default. Nenita wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Nydia

texts.en:
Nydia is 58 years old married woman with two children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nydia makes food in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and milk.

Nydia has been in business for five years.  In the future, Nydia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, 28, is a married woman with four children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marivic has two children who attend school.

Marivic sells firewood in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.  Marivic has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to sell.

loans.name: Khoern's Group

texts.en:
Khoern, 35, is married with three dependent children. She lives in a rural village in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. 

She earns a living through farming rice, while her husband works as a worker to help earn income to support the family. Together, they can earn about 25,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day from the current business and save about 15,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is Khoern's eighth microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She successfully used the previous loans to improve her living conditions. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Khoern will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labour. 

She hopes to produce more rice and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Kamsot's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Banteay Meachey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Kamsot is 27 years old and married. She has two dependent children who are in school. 

Kamsot's main source of income is from rice farming.  Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn a daily income of KHR40,000 to support her family.  She saves about KHR20,000 per day for future needs. 

This is the eighth loan for Kamsot with Kiva’s partner VisionFund.  She is now leading her group.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. 

Kamsot hopes to make more income from her business. She hopes to increase her crop yield to make life better for her family and to occupy a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en:
Joanina, 38, is married and has four children.  She lives in a town near a school; her convenience store kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

Joanina is applying for a loan of $1.000 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin).  She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store.  Supplies include noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, eggs, coffee, soap, bread, shampoo and a variety of other items.

Joanina is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock for her convenience store.

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
Romelia es una mujer luchadora, tiene 36 años de edad y vive en el Departamento de San Martin junto a sus 3 hijos.
Desde hace más de 1 año vive separado de su esposo, por lo que ella tuvo que salir adelante sola. Fue dura la separación, pero eso no fue impedimento para que trabajara y saliera adelante por sus hijos que son lo más maravilloso que tiene.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida, ofrece diversos platos como “asado de pollo, juanes, arroz con pollo, arroz chaufa, tacacho con cecina, entre otros”; le va muy bien porque es una mujer que a pesar de las adversidades ha sabido sobresalir y luchar por el bienestar de su familia, también, cabe resaltar que sus platillos son de la mejor calidad y muy ricos.
Romelia está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá invertir en su negocio, como comprar más herramientas de trabajo como ollas, cucharas, tenedores, platos, mesas, sillas así como mercadería para ampliar su negocio y de esta manera atraer más clientes, con esto, poco a poco con el esfuerzo y dedicación con el que trabaja podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: “Brindar un futuro mejor y elevar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Romelia is a determined woman. She is 36 years old and lives in San Martin Department with her three children.

She has been separated from her husband for more than a year and therefore has had to get ahead alone. The separation was difficult but did not prevent her from working and getting ahead for her children, who are the most marvelous thing she has.

Currently she makes a living selling food. She offers various dishes, such as “asado de pollo,” “juanes,”. “arroz con pollo,” “arroz chaufa,” and “tacacho con cecina,” among others. It is going very well for her because she is a woman, who, despite adversity, has known how to stand out and struggle for the well-being of her family. Also, it should be pointed out that her dishes are of the best quality and very delicious.

Romelia is grateful to Kiva lenders because due to their support she will be able to invest in her business by purchasing more work tools, such as pots, spoons, forks, plates, tables and chairs, as well as merchandise to expand her business. In this way she will attract more customers. Little by little, due to the effort and dedication with which she works, she will be able to fulfill her greatest dream, to provide a better future for, and raise the quality of life of her children.”

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs, pots, plates, cutlery to equip her business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 28 year old man who has one child.  He describes himself as determined.  Anthony operates a barber shop and has been in business for four years. 

His business is located in a rural area.  He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of funds.  He will use the Kes 15000 loan to buy a hair cutting machine and mirrors to enable him to expand his business. 

Anthony's business goal is to excel within five years.  This is his second loan with SMEP micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy a hair cutting machine and mirrors to expand his business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 43 years old and has one child. She is a single parent who lives in a rural community. To have additional income, she engages in selling frozen foods within her community. Despite financial hardship, she has the determination to uplift their status of living someday. To this end, she wants to improve more of her business in order to generate sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she wants to avail herself of a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of frozen foods like hot dogs, tocino, ham, corned beef and pork sausages to sell. Through this loan, she is hoping that someday she will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods like hot dogs, tocino, ham, corned beef and pork sausages to sell

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Sur, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 58 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 2,0000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Corazon has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Pia

texts.en:
Pia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more materials like abaca fiber, rope, etc. for her weaving business.

Pia has been in this business for 20 years. Pia earns more income from a general store.

Pia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like abaca fiber, rope, etc. for her weaving business

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Sokha is 46 years old and married. 

For the past 28 years, she has been farming rice while her husband is in house construction to support the family. With the current business, she can earn about KHR 30,000 per day and can save about KHR 18,000 each day for their future needs.

Sokha is just with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. Sokha wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mario Wilson

texts.es:
Mario tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con sus hijo de 8 y 3 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo  se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma ciudad y que se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Mario se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para la compra insumos agrícolas para los sembríos. Las compras lo realizan en Ventanas. Su meta es mejorar la producción de la siembra. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte.
texts.en: 40-year-old Mario is married and lives with his children (aged 8 and 3) in Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. He is a member of the Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo solidarity group which is based in the city of Pueblo Viejo. The group is made up of 10 members from the same city who all work in agriculture and livestock breeding. Mario grows corn and is seeking this loan to buy agricultural supplies for his crops.  He will buy them in Ventanas. His aim is to improve his production but transporting his crops proves a challenge. In his free time, he enjoys indulging in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his corn crops

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.en:
Santiaga is 42 years old and has five children. Santiaga is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Santiaga is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Santiaga requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Santiaga has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Santiaga would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pedro Miguel

texts.es: Pedro esta muy agradecido ccon el apoyo que le brindan los prestamists kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar una refrigeradora, ya que actualmente no cuenta con este artefacto y no puede conservar los alimentos en buenas condiciones; de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, lo que le permitira seguir trabjando en su empleo como obrero de campo con el cual tiene ingresos para poder salir adelante y cumplir su gran sueño: “darle a su familia una vida digna y terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en: Pedro is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support in enabling him to buy a fridge. He currently does not have one which means that he cannot store items of food properly. The fridge will improve his family's quality of life, which will allow him to continue working as a farm labourer and to earn an income which will enable him to make progress and achieve his big ambition: "to provide a decent life for his family and to complete building work on his house".

loans.use: to buy a fridge

loans.name: Eber David

texts.es:
Eber es un hombre trabajador, con 36 años de edad vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 4 años se dedica a la Agricultura, cultivando productos de la zona. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por eso que sale muy temprano a trabajar y regresa en las noches porque quiere ofrecer productos de primera calidad para poder ofrecerlos en el mercado a un precio competitivo.
Eber está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes, plaguicidas, así como cubrir los costos de riego, mantenimiento de la tierra y cultivos hasta la época de la cosecha, de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos que podrá ahorrarlos para más adelante poder cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su casa propia y apoyar a su familia.”
texts.en:
At 36 years old, Eber is a hard-working man who lives with his family in Ica.

For over four years, Eber has worked in farming, growing products that are from the local area. Eber has a strong desire to prosper and so heads out to work very early, and arrives home at night. Eber wants to sell top quality products at a competitive price at the market.

Eber is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy supplies such as fertilisers and anti-disease treatments, and to pay for irrigation. He will also be able to look after the crops until harvest-time. All of this will mean that Eber will earn a higher income; he can save that income in order achieve his great dream of having his own house and supporting his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilisers and anti-disease treatments; to pay for irrigation and for looking after the harvest.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susan is 41 years old and four of her children are currently in school.

Susan has a native basket weaving business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

Susan has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell to her customers.

Presentacion has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from raising livestock.

Presentacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is single and has a electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 31 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Cristina has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 2 years and also earns an income from buying and selling corn.

Cristina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 56 years old and widowed with four children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been in the pig fattening business for 20 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sreyhean

texts.en:
A 34-year-old mother of one child, Sreyhean resides in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. 

To support her living, she has been farming rice for two years. To supplement her income, she also works as a garment worker and her husband also works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about KHR 18,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 40,000 each day for their future needs.  

This is the first loan for Sreyhean with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of KHR 3,400,000 and she will use this loan to buy a decent motorbike for her family to commute to work, and she will use a portion of it to spend on renovating her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her family to commute to work

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is married with two school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Mbodze has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years. She sells from home to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the loan she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Angel Luis

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 26 años de edad, de estado soltero, vive con su conviviente y  sus hijos de 4 y 1 años de edad, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo  se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma ciudad y que se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Ángel  se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando maíz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es mejorar la venta de la producción de maíz. Su desafío es el clima y las plagas en sus sembríos. En su tiempo libre le gusta estar con sus hijos.
texts.en: 26-year-old Angel is unmarried and lives with his partner and his two children (aged 4 and 1) in Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  He is a member of the Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo solidarity group which is based in the city of Pueblo Viejo. The group is made up of 10 members from the same city who all work in agriculture and livestock breeding. Angel works in agriculture, growing corn and is applying for this loan to buy manure and fertiliser. he will buy these things in Ventanas. His goal is to grow more corn although he has to face the challenge of the climate and crop pests. In his free time, he enjoys spending time with his children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is a hardworking and enterprising woman who  owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman with three school-going children.

Alima sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Meti

texts.en: Meti is 38 years old. He has been married for 9 years and has a 7-year-old boy who is going to first grade this year. Meti loves his family and works hard to provide a good life for them. The family is living at Dadali village of Fuzuli region, but they are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. Meti has a small store, where he repairs phones and installs programs for phones. A while ago his computer was damaged and to buy a new computer he needs a loan in the amount of 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat).

loans.use: to buy a new computer

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’TESSONI commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame ABY assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of group Benkadi 1 are married women. They are on average 43 years old with three children, and most of them live in traditional families in N’Tessoni (Lobougoula township, Sikasso circle in Mali’s third administrative region).

They are collaborating with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their tenth loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso; previous loans were paid back on time.

Mrs. Aby’s cultivar of choice is rice; she is sitting in the first position from right to left in the photo of this group of women, Benkadi 1. With her loan, she plans to purchase one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, 1 container of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing labor on 1.2 acres.

After the harvest, production is sold in the village and in Sikasso, to a mixed-gender clientele paying cash or requesting credit.

Mrs. Aby forecasts an average profit of 73,000 XOF per cycle. The revenue will allow her to repay her loan with its interest on the one hand, and on the other to support her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’TESSONI commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame MAH débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 2.

Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.

Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

Mrs. Mah’s cultivar of choice is rice; she is the first woman standing from right to left in the photo of this group of women, Benkadi 2. With her loan, she plans to purchase one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, 1 container of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing labor on 1.2 acres.

After the harvest, production is sold in the village and in Sikasso, to a mixed-gender clientele paying cash or requesting credit.

loans.use: to buy fertilier and herbicide, and pay plowing costs.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:

Mrs. Tene’s cultivar of choice is rice; she is the first woman standing from right to left in the photo of this group of women, Benkadi 3. With her loan, she plans to purchase one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, 1 container of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing labor on 1.2 acres.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à N'TESSONI dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame BARAKISSA assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of group Benkadi 4 are married women. They are on average 41 years old with three children, and most of them live in traditional families in N’Tessoni (Lobougoula township, Sikasso circle in Mali’s third administrative region).

They are collaborating with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their tenth loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso; previous loans were paid back on time.

Mrs. Barakissa’s cultivar of choice is rice; she is the second woman sitting from right to left in the photo of this group of women, Benkadi 4. With her loan, she plans to purchase one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, 1 container of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing labor on 1.2 acres.

After the harvest, production is sold in the village and in Sikasso, to a mixed-gender clientele paying cash or requesting credit.

Mrs. Barakissa forecasts an average profit of 73,000 XOF per cycle. The revenue will allow her to repay her loan with its interest on the one hand, and on the other to support her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Dúo Emprendedoras De Sacatepequez Group

texts.es: Dúo Emprendedoras de Sacatepequez La encargada de este grupo es la señora Emilia quien tiene 28 años de edad, su negocio es una tienda de ropa para damas y caballeros, donde vende pantalones de lona y tela en diferentes tallas y clores, blusas de diferente calidad y tallas, también vende ropa de bebé en general desde hace 3 años. Tiene a parte de la venta de ropa, una venta de verduras desde hace 1 año. Aun no tienen hijos y su esposo es su gran ayuda en los negocios. Tiene varios pedidos de ropa para dama como blusas, pantalones, suéteres, calzado y también varios trajes de bebe en diferentes tallas y colores, pero el dinero que tiene no le es suficiente y necesita un préstamo para poder tener más producto y no quedarles mal a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dúo Emprendedoras de Sacatepequez 
This group is run by 28-year-old Emilia who runs a business selling women's and men's clothing. She has been selling canvas and cloth trousers in different sizes and colours, blouses of different quality and sizes and also baby clothes for 3 years. In addition to selling clothing, she has also sold vegetables for a year. She and her husband do not have children yet and he is a big help to her in the business. She has a number of orders for women's clothing, such as trousers, jumpers and footwear, and also baby clothes in different sizes and colours.  However, the money she as does not cover her needs and so she is seeking a loan to enable her to buy more goods and avoid looking bad in the eyes of her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Slyvia

texts.en: Sylvia busies herself tending her little sari-sari store in Deboloc, Plaridel. She is 57 years old and a Microfinance member of Paglaum. She is thankful for her start-up capital from PMPC and she is able to expand through the Cooperative. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase inventories of sugar, oil, and soap to sell. She hopes to sustain her store so that she can regularly pay her obligations with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of sugar, oil, and soap to sell

loans.name: Maximo Ariel

texts.es:
Ariel tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo  se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma ciudad y que se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Ariel se dedica a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es comprar un terreno propio. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Ariel is 25 years old, single and lives with his parents in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province of Ecuador.

Ariel is a member of the "Ciudad de Pueblo Viejo" communal bank, located in the town of Pueblo Viejo. The group has ten members from the same city, and who all work in farming and raising animals.

Ariel makes a living sowing corn. He is applying for this loan in order to buy farming supplies in Ventanas. Ariel's goal is to buy his own land; one challenge he is facing is transport. In his free time, Ariel likes to go out walking.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Pablo Bernardo

texts.es:
Pablo esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una refrigeradora, con la cual podrá mejorar su calidad de vida ya que podrá conservar los alimentos en mejores condiciones, a su vez que de esta manera podrá ahorrar, ya que no tendra la necesidad de comprar los alimentos todos los días.

Pablo trabaja como chofer de mototaxi y con este humilde empleo puede tener ingresos para apoyar a su familia y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una carrera profesional”.
texts.en:
Pablo is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy a fridge. This will help him to improve his quality of life as he will be able to keep his food in better condition. At the same time, he will also be able to save money as he will not need to buy food every day.

Pablo makes a living driving a rickshaw and, with this humble job, he earns an income to support his family and continue fighting to make his great dream of having a university degree a reality.

loans.use: to buy a fridge.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a single woman. She has a child who is 2 years old. She describes herself as determined. She operates a kiosk where she sells bangles and bracelets. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for business and her primary customers are students. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will benefit from the loan and improve her standard of living. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Nat is aged 37 years and married. She has four children, three of whom are still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been in rice farming for 15 years. The current business earns her family about 34,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Nat has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for  her farmland

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Dambae district, Seang is aged 35 years and is married with three children, one of whom is still in school. She and her husband earn a living through growing cassava. Having been in this business for 17 years, she manages to earn about 40,000 KHR per day and can save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Seang has been with VisionFund for one cycle and now she is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
A 39-year-old married mother residing in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Srey has three children to take care of and earns a living through farming. To supplement the family’s income, her husband also works as a paid worker. Having been in this business for 19 years, she and her husband can earn about KHR 30,000 per day to make a living and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. 

Srey has been with VisionFund for one cycle. And now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more cassava so as to increase her family’s income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz marina es un adorable mujer la cual se ha destacado por su buena sazón al realizar las comidas, ha trabajado en restaurantes y casas de familia y hace aproximadamente 4 años tiene su negocio de venta de comidas cerca de un sitio muy comercial donde ya es una mujer muy reconocida. A sus 63 años de edad este es la única entrada de dinero pues su edad le juega un papel en contra a la hora de conseguir un empleo, tiene un hijo de 37 años de edad que le ayuda brindándole apoyo monetario y afectivo pues su esposo falleció.
Como persona solo aspira a que su negocio siga creciendo sus ventas sigan estables y quiere tener más clientes solicita un crédito para adecuar su carrito de comidas para tener más espacios y así ofertar un mayor número de  productos y surtido de materia para elaborar sus exquisitas comidas muy típicas en Colombia como lo son el buñuelo, la empana, el pastel de pollo, entre otros.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is an adorable woman who is known for the great flavours in her meals. She has worked in restaurants and for families but for around four years she has had a business selling meals in a very commercial area; she is very well-known there. At 63 years old, this business is Luz's only source of income as given her age she is unable to find a job. Luz has a 37-year-old son; he has given her financial and emotional support since Luz's husband died.

Luz aspires to see her business continue to grow and to have stable sales; Luz also wants to have more customers. Luz is applying for a loan in order to improve her cart so as to have more space and be able to offer a greater number of products. Luz will also stock up on supplies for preparing delicious and typical Colombian foods, such as "buñuelo" and "empanadas" (types of pastries), chicken pies and more.

loans.use: to improve her cart and offer more goods; Luz will also buy supplies for making her excellent dishes.

loans.name: Chhit's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Chhit is 27 years old and is married with two children. She has earned a living through farming rice and working as paid worker for seven years. She can earn about KHR 70,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 30,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the sixth loan for Chhit with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, Chhit wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is married with six children, two of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of reeds and a tin of dye for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of reeds and a tin of dye for her business.

loans.name: Beelqis Group

texts.en:
This group is called Beelqis. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.
 
Rahma is a 20-year-old single woman. She is the leader of the group. Rahma lives with her family in their own house. She studied till secondary school. She is very dynamic and vigorous. Her father is the sole breadwinner of the family. The family lives in a small house and it is not renovated on the inside. As a result, Rahma is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement in order to renovate the house on the inside.

Rahma's dream in the future is building more houses of one floor and renovating them. She hopes to make the house of the family more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement in order to renovate the house on the inside.

loans.name: Khanya's Group

texts.en:
Khanya, 29, lives with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Srey Snom district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Khanya and her husband have been farming rice for the last four years, earning about 10,000KHR per day to spend for the family’s needs. 

Khanya has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely repaid her loans. Now she is leading her group to request a new one. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. Khanya hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 21 years old. He is a student who lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Due to the lack of financial support, he would like to apply for loan of $1,500 to pay for his tuition. This loan will help him get a higher education. In the future, Simon hopes that he can be on the staff of a bank or a Non-Governmental Organization.

loans.use: to pay his tuition

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is a Kiva borrower. She has 4 children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a remote area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à N'TESSONI dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame BINTOU assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 5. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of group Benkadi 5 are married women. They are on average 35 years old with four children, and most of them live in traditional families in N’Tessoni (Lobougoula township, Sikasso circle in Mali’s third administrative region).

They are collaborating with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their tenth loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso; previous loans were paid back on time.

Mrs. Bintou’s cultivar of choice is rice; she is the second woman sitting from left to right in the photo of this group of women, Benkadi 5. With her loan, she plans to purchase one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, 1 container of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing labor on 1.2 acres.

After the harvest, production is sold in the village and in Sikasso, to a mixed-gender clientele paying cash or requesting credit.

Mrs. Bintou forecasts an average profit of 73,000 XOF per cycle. The revenue will allow her to repay her loan with its interest on the one hand, and on the other to support her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Marceliana

texts.en:
Marceliana is married and has a native basket-making business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

She has requested a loan of 21,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional materials for her business.

Marceliana has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is single and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Marivic has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nawoodi Group

texts.fr:
Mme  HALIMA est responsable du groupe  NAWOODI. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgés à 08 mois. Les 02 vont  à l’école.
Mme  vend des céréales et du miel depuis  plus de 10ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter  25l de miel et 12 plats de petit mil.	
Elle veut épargner  ses bénéfices afin d’acheter du céréale stocker. Mme  ambitionne aider son mari avec la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Halima is the leader of group Nawoodi. She is doing well. She is married, and a mother of four. The oldest is eleven, and the youngest is eight months old. Two of the children are going to school.

Mrs. Halima has been selling cereals and honey for over ten years. She purchases her supplies from her local market.

She wants to purchase 25 liters of honey and 12 small dishes of millet. 

Her goal is to save her profit in order to purchase cereals to stock. She ambitions to help her husband with her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase 25 liters of honey and 12 small dishes of millet.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea, 32, lives in a rural village in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is a married mother of three children. Her family’s income comes from leasing a rice paddy. 

Chea has been in this business for 22 years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about 80,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and manage to save about 20,000 KHR per day for future needs. 

Chea has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Now, she is leading her group in this request for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, pencils, books, sugar, coffee and salt. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Maria is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, pencils, books, sugar, coffee and salt

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  BENKADI 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à N'TESSONI dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame DIAMATIO débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 6. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the group BENKADI 3 are married women who average 32 years of age and 4 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in N'TESSONI, commune of LOBOUGOULA, in the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season and this is their 10th time partnering with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. DIAMATIO grows rice. She is the member standing first from the left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy one 50-kg sack of fertilizer and one jug of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mrs. Diamatio expects to earn an average profit of 73,000 FCFA per campaign, which she will use to repay her loan and the interest, and also to help her husband with the family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Kogltaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFYA est responsable du groupe KOGLTAABA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgés à 11 mois. Les 03 vont  à l’école.
Mme  vend de la farine de maïs, du piment et des condiments  depuis  11ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter  des condiments secs (gombo 01sac, des épices) et du piment 01sac.	
Elle veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne  acheter plus du céréale pour la farine et aider son mari pour les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. SAFYA is the leader of the KOGLTAABA group. She is married with four children aged 11 months to 22 years old, three of whom attend school. 

Mrs. Safya has been selling maize flour, peppers and condiments for 11 years. She buys her stock at the market of her sector. 

She plans to buy dry condiments (one bag of okra, some spices), and one bag of peppers.

She wants to use her profits to strengthen her activity. Her goals are to bolster her stock of grain for her flour supply, and to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy dried condiments (one bag of okra, some spices), and one bag of peppers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement blocks, sand, cement, zinc sheeting, and iron.

loans.name: Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
