Les 7 membres du groupe  BENKADI 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à N'TESSONI dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame KOROTOUMOU débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 7. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi 7 group are married women. On average, they are 33 years old and have three children. Most of them live in traditional families in N’Tessoni, a village in the town of Lobougoula, Sikasso Cercle, 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their farming activities through the rainy season. This is their 10th farming loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans were repaid. 

They plant rice with Madame Korotoumou who is standing on the far left in this photo of Benkadi  7. With her loan, she will pay for one 50 kg bag of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and for plowing for 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, she sells her crops in Sikasso for cash and credit, and to both men and women. She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 73,000 FCFA per season.

These profits will help her pay her loan and interest and help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer, plowing, and herbicides.

loans.name: Seyma

texts.en:
Seyma is 21 years old. He is a student who lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

Due to the lack of financial support, he would like to apply for loan of $1,500 to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him get a higher education. 

In the future, Seyma hopes that he can be a staff member of a bank or a Non-Governmental Organization.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Sinignessigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe  SINIGNESSIGUI 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 51 ans, ont en moyenne 9 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur septième prêt de production de maïs  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur ZANA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  SINIGNESSIGUI 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 16 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 30 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  4 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 300 0000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the Sinignessigui 1 group are married men who, on average, are 51 years old and have nine children. They mostly live in traditional families in Kolokoba, an area of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan, and their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Zana, standing first from the right in the photo, grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy 16 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and 30 drums of different herbicides, and to pay the cost of labor to farm four hectares of land. 

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Zana hopes to earn an average profit of 300,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will help him pay back his part of the loan and its interest and also help to cover his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Renzo Luis

texts.es: Renzo esta muy agradecido lo prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, como refacción de paredes, techo, entre otros, asimismo podrá comprar algunos materiales para su trabajo como electricista como alicates, multitester, entre otros; de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desempeñar un mejor trabajo, ya que actualmente trabaja en un fundo agrícola, realizando trabajos como electricista, de esta manera puede tener ingresos para salir adelante y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Renzo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their support, he will be able to make improvements to his house.  He will do things like repair the walls and the roof, among others.  He will be able to buy some materials for his work as an electrician.  He will buy things like pliers and a multitester, among others.

This way he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life, and he will be able to do a better job.

He currently works doing electrician jobs on a farm.  This way he is able to have income in order to get ahead and struggle to make his big dream a reality.  His dream is to have his own business.

loans.use: to improve his house and to buy materials for is work as an electrician.

loans.name: Vaneza

texts.en: Vaneza is 33 years old, married, and from Usocan, Plaridel. She has a fishing business and sells the catch in her neighborhood. Her fishing activities have sufficiently provided for her family. Vaneza has signed up for membership with PMPC to access insurance and capital needs. Now, she has applied for a loan to purchase additional rope for fishing. She wants to improve her fishing equipment to effectively catch more fish. In the future, Vaneza hopes to sustain her business and become the fish dealer in the nearby municipality.

loans.use: to purchase additional rope for fishing

loans.name: Kanouya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe   KANOUYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursé.
Madame KIATOU débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes   KANOUYA, fait la vente des savons.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 cartons de savon au grand marché pour la revendre en détail à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit à OUAYERMA I. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the KANOUYA group are married women who average 34 years of age and four children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They are partnering with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the second time to meet customer demand. Their first loan was correctly repaid.

Mrs. Kiatou sells soaps. She is the member standing first from the right in the group photo. She plans to use her loan to buy two cartons of soaps at the big market. She will then retail her stock in Ouayerma I to a clientele consisting of both men and women, for cash and on credit. She is in high demand due to the quality of her merchandise.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, part of which will be used to repay this loan and the interest while the remainder will be added to her savings.

loans.use: to buy soaps for resale.

loans.name: Antonio Jobo

texts.es:
Jobo tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su hija en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma ciudad y que se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Jobo se dedicaba a la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida con la finalidad de mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jobo is 48 years old and single.  He lives with his daughter in the Ventanas canton in the Ríos province.

He is a member of the Ciudad de Pueblo Viejo communal bank, which is located in the city of Pueblo Viejo.  It is comprised of ten members who are from the same city and work in agriculture and with livestock.

Jobo works in agriculture.  He is requesting the loan to buy compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea, and fungicides in order to improve his crop production.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  His goal is to improve the production of his crops.  His challenge is the transportation.

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 45 years old and married and has one child, who is in school.

Vicenta is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Vicenta has been fattening pigs for 16 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Johaira

texts.en:
Johaira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling cellphones and accessories in the Philippines. Johaira has been in this business for two years now.

Johaira requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stock of accessories to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vivian is 31 years old and has five children who are in school.

Vivian has a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

Vivian has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana is taking a loan of 800 USD to improve her business. She is married and runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as oils, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, bread and soy sauce. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 600 USD. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with her loan because it is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy oils, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, bread and soy sauce

loans.name: Sihoung's Group

texts.en:
Sihoung, 24, lives with her husband and one child in a rural village in the Srey Snom district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Sihoung and her husband earn a living as farmers; they have been farming rice and cassava for six years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day to spend on the family’s needs. 

This is Sihoung’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group has only two members, who are just with VisionFund for this cycle. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Sihoung is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her family’s business. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her family’s business

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir is 45 years old, married, and has two children. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land Fuzuli city and now live in the  Fuzuli region-Amirzeyidli village. 

Mahir has a store where he sells fruits and vegetables. Today Mahir wants to support his business and therefore he has applied to  Komak company for a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy seasonal goods for selling. He says thanks to the Kiva organization for help. In the future Mahir wants to build a new store.

loans.use: to buy seasonal goods for selling

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 59 years old, married to Naomi and they have five children ages between 10 to 19 years old. 

She has been in the farming business for the past 35 years with a monthly income of KES 15,000.                           

She has applied for this second loan of KES 25,000 with VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs (e.g., seedlings and fertilizer) for use on the farm to improve the harvest. She plans to use the anticipated income to expand her business and educate her children.
	
She hopes to have a bright future and venture into large scale farming

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  KELEGNA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame MAMA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  KELEGNA, fait la vente des  mèches et la coiffure.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  1 carton de 12 paquets de mèche, une douzaine des pommades, des quantités importantes de petit matériel pour la coiffure des femmes dont elle dispose un salon de coiffure à OUAYERMA I pour la revendre en détail dans son salon de coiffure à une clientèle composée des femmes au comptant et à crédit . Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle par la qualité de ses produits.
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kelegna group are married women. On average, they are 44 years old and have five children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma, a working class area of Sikasso in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

This is the fourth group loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso that they’ve used to satisfy their clientele.

Madame Mama, standing second from the left in this photo of Kelegna, styles and sells hair.

She would like to buy a 12-pack box of hair, a dozen hair styling products, and a large amount of other hair supplies for women. She has a hair salon in Ouayerma where she sells these items to women for retail prices and for cash and credit.

She is sought after for the quality of her products. She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA that she will use to pay her loan and interest and to add to her savings.

loans.use: buy hair, hair styling products, and other women's hair products.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn has a store in Lopez Jaena. She is a microfinance member of PMPC and has taken previous loans several times already. Analyn gained access to insurance and also capitalization from the Cooperative. 

Analyn has carefully managed her store and is able to expand with a promising income of 5,000 PHP per month. Recently, she applied for a loan to restock the store with noodles and canned goods to sell. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to restock her store with noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Waithira

texts.en:
Waithira is a 25-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a greengrocery where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are regular daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to expand her business. Her business goal is to have a successful business that will attract more customers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to sustain her family.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is a single man. He describes himself as focused. 

He operates an M-pesa business where he offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a remote area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KSh 20,000 loan to add M-pesa float (i.e. electronic money) for customers to withdraw. His business goal is to excel within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be a better person. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and open another branch.

loans.use: add M-pesa float (i.e. electronic money) for customers to withdraw

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 29 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Anabelle has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for three years.  In the future, she would like save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rojena

texts.en:
A $700.00 loan is offered to Rojena to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like noodles, beer, coffee, sugar, and salt.

Rojena is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy noodles, beer, coffee, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers to cultivate sown wheat

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru:
Насиба в возрасте 40 лет начинает новый бизнес. Она рядом со школой своего села района Шахритус открывает магазин, где она планирует заняться продажей продуктов питания. Для этой цели у нее имеется удобное помещение, а также начальный капитал в размере 615 долларов США. Однако для купли товара этой суммы недостаточно, в связи с чем Насиба обратилась за кредитом. Продукты для продажи она будет приобретать с оптового рынка района. 
Благодаря кредиту у Насибы будет работа, а у ее семьи новый источник дохода, что позволит им улучшить их финансовое положение.
texts.en:
Nasiba is 40 years old and is starting a new business. She is opening a store next to the school in her village, in the region of Shahrituz. She plans to sell food products here. She has good premises for this purpose, and also start-up capital of 615 US dollar. However this sum is not enough to purchase goods, and for this reason Nasiba applied for a loan. She will purchase the products from the wholesale market in the region. 

Thanks to the loan, Nasiba will have work, and her family will have a new source of income, which will enable them to improve their financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase food products for opening a store

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 37 years old and married with three children, with one child currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, coffee, sugar, etc., to sell.  She has been in this business for seven years.

Andresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, softdrinks, shampoo, coffee, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Serelyn

texts.en:
Serelyn is 37 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Serelyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more rice to sell.

Serelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for her previous loan that improved her clothes selling business. Besides the clothes selling business, Binti operates a shop kiosk.

She is requesting a loan to purchase wheat flour, sugar and salt for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and salt for resale

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Domingas to improve her business. She is married and she has five children. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like onions and garlic. Domingas is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy onions and garlic

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 48 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 13 years to 28 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farming business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are individual residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs to expand and diversify her business. Her business goal is to own a grocery store within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sinignessigui 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  SINIGNESSIGUI 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur septième prêt de production de maïs  avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur YAYA débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  SINIGNESSIGUI 2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 8 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 2 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145 0000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the group SINIGNESSIGUI 2 are married men who average 46 years of age and 7 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in KOLOKOBA, a commune located in the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season and this is their 7th time partnering with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mr. YAYA grows maize. He is the member standing second from the right in the group photo. He will use his loan to buy eight 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and eight jugs of various grades of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 2 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mr. Yaya expects to earn an average profit of 145,000 FCFA per campaign, which will allow him to repay his loan and the interest, and also to cover part of his family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 27-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

He operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are regular daily customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. His business goal is to have a successful business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he has a stable business that will sustain his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Panha

texts.en:
Panha age 19, is single. She lives with her parents and brother on the Island of Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Panha is a second year student, majoring in nursing at the university in Phnom Penh. She hopes to graduate in 2015, and she will become a professional nurse for a hospital or clinic.

She is asking for a loan in order to pay for her school fee.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees

loans.name: Leovigildo

texts.es:
Leovigildo es una persona con 44 años de edad, vive en Ica junto a su esposa y su hijo.
Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, por lo que desde hace más de 3 años se dedica a la agricultura, alquilando un pequeño terreno en la zona donde reside, y con el dinero que gana puede cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Una de sus mayores metas es brindarle un futuro mejor y una educación de calidad a su pequeño hijo y por supuesto formarlo como una persona de bien.
Se caracteriza por ser amable, responsable, trabajador y respetuoso, es por ello que labora incansablemente para que sus cosechas sean de la mejor calidad, utilizando siempre insumos que no dañen los cultivos ni el medio ambiente.
Leovigildo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque gracias al apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos para lograr una mejor producción, así como realizará un control fitosanitario de toda la cosecha, riego de las plantaciones y pago de planilla de labores de cultivo. Gracias a esto podrá tener ingresos adicionales para que más adelante pueda cumplir su mayor sueño: “Construir su casa propia de material noble”.
texts.en:
Leovigildo is 44 years old and lives in Ica with his wife and son.  He is eager to get ahead, so for more than 3 years has been engaged in farming, renting a small plot of land in the area where he lives.  With the money he earns, he can cover the cost of his home.

One of his major goals is to provide a better future and a quality education for his young son and raise him to be a good person.  He is characterized as friendly, responsible, hardworking and respectful, which is why he works tirelessly so that his crops are of the highest quality.  He uses materials that are not damaging crops or the environment.

Leovigildo is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they have given him.  He can buy materials for better production and perform pest control for the entire crop, crop irrigation and payment of labor to help him till the soil. Thanks to this, he will have additional income for later to fulfill his greatest dream: "Build my own house of proper material."

loans.use: to pay for pest control, irrigation, maintenance and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements (fix her roof and  buy other materials).

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 50 years old, married, and has seven children. Four of her children are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melissa has a general store business in the Philippines. Melissa requested a 28,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, and other grocery items.

Melissa has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Melissa would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, and other grocery items

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman and has three school going children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is taking a loan of 1,000 USD to improve her business, a second hand clothing business that helps her to generate income for her family.  She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as shirts, long pants, and shorts.  She opened her second hand clothing business a year ago with her own working capital of 600 USD.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a larger business in the future

loans.use: to buy shirts, long pants, and shorts.

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
En muchas ocasiones un trabajo es quizás desvalorado y poco visto lo que no saben muchas personas es que son los ganaderos y agricultores los que hacen que cada día podamos disfrutar un bocado de comida y lo más importante es que ellos saben que su trabajo es vital para que cada persona desempeñe sus actividades diarias con normalidad ya que  son ellos quienes proporcionan la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos. Guillermo más conocido como “memo” es un agricultor específicamente criador de ganado el cual estudio un curso técnico relacionado con su actividad y ha sido muy beneficio ya que el mismo pone las vacunas y realiza el cuidado de sus animales.
Adquirió la finca por parte de su padre quien  sufrió una parálisis celebrar y “memo” se hizo cargo de la finca. 
En busca de mejorar sus utilidades y afianzar más la finca solicita un crédito para la compra de más ganado ya que se proyecta a tener 40 cabezas de reces en su finca lo que lo pondría a la cabeza como uno de los principales ganaderos del sector el cual como único sueño es seguir la tradición familiar y brindarle a su dos hijos una excelente calidad.
texts.en: Often a profession is perhaps undervalued and unseen.  What many people don't know is that it is because of what ranchers and farmers do each day that we can enjoy a plate of food.  It is most important that they know that their work is vital for each person to be able to complete his daily activities in a normal fashion, because they are providing the raw material for our meals.  Guillermo, who goes by "Memo", works in agriculture, specifically raising cattle.  He took a technical degree course related to this activity which has been very helpful as he vaccinates and cares for the animals himself. He acquired his land from his father who suffered a stroke and Memo took over the ranch.  Wanting to improve his profits and strengthen the position of  the ranch he is requesting a loan to purchase more cows.  He is projecting to have 40 head of cattle on his ranch which would make him one of the key ranchers in the sector.  His only dream is to continue his family's tradition and provide his two children with an excellent education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to increase the credibility of his ranch and to have more animals for sale.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Angeline has a business buying and selling ready to wear in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more ready to wear to sell.

Angeline has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Maria del Socorro trabaja para el centro de salud publico desde hace 18 años como enfermera, este credito lo requiere para comprar material de construccion como zinc, perlines y mano de obra ya que salio afectada con los terremotos ocurridos en abril del 2014 con daño parciasl en el techo y dormitorio, agradece a ceprodel por haberle brindado el apoyo por medio el credito otorgado.
texts.en: Maria del Socorro has worked in a public health center for 18 months as a nurse.  She needs this loan to purchase construction materials such as zinc, beams, and labor, as she was impacted by the earthquakes in April 2014 which partially damaged her roof and bedroom.  She is thankful to Ceprodel for having provided support through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en:
Phanna (in photo), is age 19 and single. He lives with his parents, grandma and brother and sister in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Phanna has finished his baccalaureate and he is now continuing his study at the university. He is a first year student, majoring in IT (Information Technology) in Phnom Penh.

He is asking for a loan in order to pay for his school fee.

loans.use: to pay for his school fee.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Nela trabaja para el centro de salud publico desde hace 22 años como Tecnica en administracion, este credito lo requiere para comprar material de construccion como zinc, perlines y mano de obra, ya que salio afectada con los terremotos ocurridos en abril del 2014 con daño parcial en el techo y paredes, agradece a ceprodel por haberle brindado el apoyo por medio el credito otorgado.
texts.en: Ms. Maria Nela has been working as an administration specialist at the public health center for 22 years. She will use the loan to buy building materials such as zinc and purlins, and to cover manual labor costs, to repair partial damage to the ceiling and walls of her home which was affected by the April, 2014 earthquakes. She is grateful to Ceprodel for giving her support through the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers buy frequently. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more fish. She hopes that in the future, she will have regular cash flow.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a food stall where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers purchase frequently. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase additional inventory. Her business goal is to own a restaurant within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business and have better cashflow.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are regular daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to to expand her business. Her business goal is to have a successful business within five years. She hopes that in the future, the business will be stable and will sustain her family's needs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 43-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy salon equipment. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snacks

loans.name: Dúo Donnis Group

texts.es: Dúo Donnis Este grupo es integrado por doña Lucia vive en el municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez, doña Lucia quien cuenta con el negocio de venta de tortillas, doña Lucia tiene la bendición de que su negocio se situé en un punto muy trascurrido por los vehículos como también de los estudiantes, y de varios negociantes, haciendo así que sus ventas sean muy buenos, ella cuenta con 3 señoritas que laboran todos los días desde muy temprano para ofrecer a todos sus clientes tortillas calientitas en 3 tiempos de comida,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz por mayor.
texts.en: Lucia is a member of the Dúo Donnis group. She lives in the municipality of San Juan Sacatepéquez and has a business selling tortillas.  Lucia is blessed that her business is located in a spot that is heavily transited by vehicles, students, and shopkeepers.  Her sales are therefore very good.  She has 3 women who work every day starting very early in the morning to offer all of her customers warm tortillas at the 3 mealtimes.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase corn wholesale.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is 33 years old. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Sherequested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for two years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando, debido a que no existía alguien que tuviera un estudio superior para enseñar. Su pareja la abandono, dejándole toda la responsabilidad a ella.  Es madre soltera de cinco hijos, todos mayares de edad, cada quien tiene su familia.

Ella se dedica al comercio, posee una tienda desde hace cinco, su madre le enseño los oficios de la casa, pero la necesidad la llevo a tener otra fuente de ingresos, por lo que decidió poner en práctica su deseo, no tiene otra actividad a la que se dedique aparte de ama de casa que es casi por deber de madre y la tienda que está ubicada en su casa;  por lo que no necesita un medio de transporte para movilizarse, la atención a los cliente lo hace de las 6:00 am a 6:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, detergentes, galletas, café, golosinas, etc.  Con lo que comprara más mercadería para tener de respaldo, para cuando se le termina no andar corriendo a comprar y quedarle mal a su clientela, el mejoramiento que tendrá será el comprar por mayoreo y poder obtener mejores ganancias. 

Los sueños que tiene es poder crecer siempre en las ventas y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que tendrá una fuente de ingreso segura, para echar mano para sus gastos. Las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y seguir  ampliando  el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 51 years old.  She attended school through second grade but did not have the opportunity to continue because there was nobody with higher education to teach classes.  Her husband left her, leaving all responsibilities to her.  She is a single mother of five children.  They are all adults and each has his/her own family.

Ana is a merchant.  She has had a store for 5 years.  Her mother taught her housework but necessity compelled her to find another source of income , so she decided to make her wish a reality. She doesn't have any other employment other than homemaker, which is almost a requirement of being a mother, and the store, which is located in her home so she doesn't need transportation to get there.  She attends to customers from 6am to 6pm. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, detergents, crackers, coffee, candy, etc.  She will purchase more merchandise to have more inventory so that when it runs out she doesn't have to rush out to buy more and disappoint her customers. This will be an improvement because she will be able to purchase wholesale and increase her profits.

Her dreams are to increase her sales and therefore increase her income so she will have a secure source of income to help with expenses.  The profits will be invested in paying off the loan and continuing to grow the business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, detergents, crackers, coffee, candy, etc.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has seven children, five in school and two underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a married woman who is 48 years old and has three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, fruits, and other products.

Pacita has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, fruits, and other products.

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en:
Blandina is a widowed woman who has been blessed with two school going children. She lives in her own house that has no electricity, but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Blandina has operated a charcoal and poultry selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is high cost of transportation.

She is requesting for a loan  to purchase charcoal and chicks for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and chicks for her business

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 27 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.  Sheila works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  Sheila has operated her business for five years, selling a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, eggs, and other groceries. 

In the future Sheila would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Al-Zhra Group

texts.en:
Al-Zhra is the same group that is composed of three women: Mnal, Samiah, and Amal. They are hardworking, enterprising women who do not give up easily. Currently they are requesting a loan of 270,000 Yemen Rials (YER) from Kiva lenders in order to increase their business levels.

Mnal is 36 years old and a married woman. She has sold incense and perfumes to customers for many years. She is able to attract good customers. She would like to apply for a third loan to return to her first business of selling incense and perfumes. After she finished the repayment of the installment of the first and second loan, she applied for the third loan of 90,000 YER from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more incense and perfumes to resell to the customers in her area. Mnal and the rest of the group thank Kiva lenders for financing their first and second loan and they hope to be provided for in this loan as well.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
This is Lindita a 47-year-old widowed mother and her 24-year-old son Elton who was born with disabilities. They come from the Egyptian vulnerable ethnic minority.  By looking at the photograph taken in front of their home, someone can tell how poor they are. Lindita’s husband passed way when the son was very young, thus she had to raise the child on her own and according to her, it was very difficult because their living conditions were extremely poor.  

Lindita works as a cleaner and her son who has chosen to go to university despite the disability get’s the disability income and from this he pays the school fees. They both live in the city of Korca, just southeastern Albania. 

The loan they request from you will be used to buy building materials to make minor repairs to their poorly built home. She has been a long-time client of VFA.

loans.use: to buy building materials to make minor repairs to their poorly built home

loans.name: Layali Al- Hisoa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Layali Al- Hisoa and it consists of four women who are all hard- working. They live in Aden, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 180,000 YER. 

Montaha is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  She is an educated woman with a secondary education. Unfortunately, she couldn't complete her studies. Montaha has a strong determination to improve her living standards. She started her business three years ago, selling makeup and accessories in order to help her husband with the family's expenses.  She started with a small amount of money. She sees this business as profitable for her.  In order to expand her business, Montaha requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to purchase more of accessories, makeup, other cosmetics, and clothes to sell to the customers in her area.

Montaha expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to renovating her house and purchasing furniture for the house.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, other cosmetics, and clothes to sell to the customers in her area

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
Nazakat is 45 years old and divorced, with a daughter and a son.  She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and kids in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  When she was 13, she started to learn to work in agriculture.  Her parents were the ones who taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income.  She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10 years now, selling her crops in the central bazaar to make profit to support her family.  

Nazakat’s income from her business is 150 AZN.  In order to improve the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business, which requires a lot of dedication and effort.  She believes that in the near future, her kids will help her to expand the business.  Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and a fun business, she wants the business to continue to prosper.  

Nazakat needs a 1,000 AZN loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and fruit trees.  Her biggest wish is to offer her children an education so that they may have good careers and help their family.  This is her first loan and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and fruit trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farmland

loans.name: Maricel

texts.es: Maricel tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos. Maricel es una mujer comprometida con su familia quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia lo necesario. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una nueva fosa séptica. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, etc. Espera contar contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Maricel is 38 years old and lives in her own home along with her children.  She is very committed to her family and does everything in her power to provide for their needs.  She has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a new septic tank.  With the requested amount she will purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks etc. She hopes to receive this loan so that she can start construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick, etc. to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Dúo Eden Group

texts.es: Dúo Eden Doña Francisca de 44 años de edad tiene 3 hijos, empezó su negocio  de carpintería con el  esposo, lo iniciaron con Q 800 quetzales, su mayor anhelo es sacar adelante a sus hijos para poderles comprar  un terreno y dejarles herencia, su propósito es agrandar su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y poder darle lo necesario a su familia, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para elavoracion de muebles.
texts.en: Doña Francisca, of the Dúo Eden group, is 44 years old and has 3 children.  She began her carpentry business with her husband for 800 Quetzales.  Her greatest desire is to help her children be successful by buying them land and leaving them an inheritance. Her goal is to grow her business to increase her income and provide for her family's needs.  She is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials to make furniture.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make furniture for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store and photocopier business. Lydia is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Mekijoli

texts.en:
Mekijoli is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity.

Mekijoli has operated a kerosene vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more kerosene for resale

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.ru: Гульназ 42 года, замужем, есть 6 детей, трое детей школьного возраста, старшие учатся в университете. Образование Гульназ средне-специальное, она работает фельдшером. В качестве дополнительного дохода последние 5 месяцев Гульназ успешно занимается частным предпринимательством, торгует на местном рынке. Гульназ продает товары хозяйственного назначения, которые закупает в Китае или в Бишкеке. Стартовав с 20,000 сом (KGS), на данный момент в обороте Гульназ имеются товары общей стоимостью 80,000 сом (KGS). Также Гульназ  занимается садоводством, полеводством и животноводством, на участке выращивает яблоки, урюк, есть небольшой парник с помидорами.  Для дальнейшего роста своего бизнеса, Гульназ  обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки хозяйственных товаров, с целью увеличения товарооборота в магазине.  Гульназ  сумела развить свой бизнес с нуля и планирует взять в аренду еще одно торговое место для продажи выращиваемой на участке продукции. Доходы от кредита Гульназ планирует вложить в оплату за обучение детей в университете.
texts.en:
Gulnaz is 42 years old. She is married and has six children. Three of the children are of school age, the older ones study at the university. Gulnaz has vocational education. She works as a paramedic. 

As an additional income, Gulnaz has for the last five months successfully had her own business. She trades at the local market. Gulnaz sells household goods, which she purchases from China or in Bishek. After having started with 20,000 som (KGS), Gulnaz currently has goods worth 80,000 som (KGS). Gulnaz also works with horticulture, agriculture and livestock breeding. She grows apples and apricots on her plot of land and she also has a small greenhouse with tomatoes. 

For the further growth of her business, Gulnaz turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS), to purchase household goods with an aim to increase the turnover of her store. 

Gulnaz has developed her business from scratch, and plans to rent an additional sales point to sell the products she has grown on her plot of land. Gulnaz plans to invest the income from the loan in paying for her children's education at the university.

loans.use: To resell household goods

loans.name: Yokonia

texts.en:
Yokonia is a forty-three-year-old married male living in Bundibugyo Uganda.  He has seven children, but only three go to school.  

He is a farmer who has been in business for eight years and it has helped him to provide for the welfare of his family and to meet daily expenses. 

He dreams of expanding his farming by buying a big piece of land and yield big quantities, though he complains of harsh weather changes. 

Yokonia is asking for a loan to buy cocoa and rent a cocoa garden to harvest and sell cocoa.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and rent a cocoa garden to harvest and sell cocoa

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and other materials.

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en:
Gabil is a 43-year-old man. He was married and has a child. His son graduated school this year in preparation for university. They are living in Mahmudlu-2 village of the Fuzuli region but they are IDP (Internationally Displaced Persons) from the same city. 

Gabil has been in the animal breeding business for 12 years. He has several cows and bulls. For the vaccination of his animals, Gabil needs a loan in the amount of 700 AZM. Gabil is thankful for the help of Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: pay for the vaccination of his animals

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a 34-year-old married mother of two. She and her husband are devoted parents who struggle to provide her children with a good education. Four years ago, Joumana started her own business selling clothes. Her six years of sales experience and university education have provided her the means to attract a large number of customers in her neighborhood. 

Joumana believes that her shop can be more successful. Her previous loan with Kiva field’s partner Al Majmoua has impacted her business and finances in an extraordinary way. She seeks a new loan to increase her inventory of clothes for the summer season. In the future, she hopes to expand her business while continuing to keep her great reputation in the area.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothes for the summer season

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a self described industrious, married woman with 4 children ranging in age from 7 years to 25 years old.  For 8 years she has operated a retail business where she sells tomatoes and fish.  Her primary customers are locals.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. 

Rose will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock of tomatoes and fish.  Her business goal is to have a fully improved and independent business within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future, she will be an independent person.  This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.  She will use the anticipated profits to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 to 13 years. She describes herself to be independent. She operates a grocery stall where she sells tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. Her business goal is to own her own grocery store within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha does a business selling agricultural produce from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan, she is requesting Kes 50,000. She wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for irrigation on her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en:
Kamene is a hardworking woman blessed with seven children, all of whom are adults. She runs a cereals store, which has been in operation for 30 years. 

She'll use the loan to purchase more maize, beans and dried peas for resale. 

Her hope is that her business does well so that she can venture into a large-scale cereals-selling business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cereals for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, beans and dried peas to sell

loans.name: Fran Wilmer

texts.es:
Fran de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, luego estudio técnico en computación. Esta acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del  hogar y al cuidado de su hijo, es quien mantiene todo ordenado en la casa. Nadie más vive con ellos.

Fran es empleado de una institución de gobierno desde hace 4 años, por empleos que había tenido anteriormente y la experiencia que tenía, fue su fuerte a la hora de presentar curriculum. También tiene ganado, una yunta de bueyes y dos vacas las que ordeña y le producen una entrada de dinero extra, anterior a este trabajo, era empleado de visión mundial, cargo que desempeñaba era de mentor en las comunidades. La distancia que recorre es de 5 kilómetros diario, su medio de transporte es su motocicleta, la que compro por la necesidad de tener un medio propio, el horario de trabajo es de  8:00 am a 4:00 pm.
  

El préstamo lo necesita para pagar una deuda que adquirió cuando compro los bueyes, al no poder  comprarlos de totalmente con su dinero le toco buscar prestado. El mejoramiento que tendrá es que ya no estara pensando que tiene que vender para pagar.

Su deseo es preparar bien su casa, ya que también la está construyendo poco a poco y que su familia tenga un lugar más digno donde vivir, espera que su hijo crezca saludable y que con la ayuda de Dios y su esfuerzo poderle dar todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Fran is 26 years old. He got his bachelor's degree in technical computing. He is married and his wife keeps house and looks after their son and keeps everything orderly. Nobody else lives with them.
Fran has been employed by a government agency for the past four years. The jobs he had held previously and the experience he gained enabled him to present strong qualifications for this job. He commutes 5 kilometers every day by motorcycle, which he purchased because he needed his own means of transportation. He works 8 a.m. - 4 p.m. every day. 
Before his current job, he had a big vision, working as a mentor for others in the community. Now he also has cattle, a group of bulls and two cows. These are a source of extra income for him. 
He needs the loan to repay a debt he incurred when he purchased his cattle, since he wasn't able to cover the entire cost with his own money he had to look for a loan. The earnings from these cattle have been enough that Fran does not wish to sell them in order to repay the loan. 
His dream is to have a good home which he is building bit-by-bit so that his family will have a more dignified place to live. He hopes that his son will grow up healthy and that, with God's help and through hard work, he will be able to provide for his son.

loans.use: to pay off a loan he incurred when he purchased cattle.

loans.name: Abir Group

texts.en:
Joumana is the featured representative of the Abir group. She and the other group members are best friends, which brought them together to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. 

Joumana is a 41-year-old married mother of three, two of whom are enrolled in a private school. She and her husband struggle to provide their children with a quality education. In 2011 Joumana started her own home business selling linens and undergarments after previously working as a chef in a hospital to help pay for the costs of sending her children to school.  

Her business is frequently visited by the residents of her neighborhood and sales are good. She is determined to use her loan to increase her current inventory for the summer season which is her peak sales period. Joumana is the lady standing at the far left side of the picture, Inaya is standing next to her in the middle and Abir is the lady wearing veil at the left.

loans.use: To increase her current inventory for the summer season which is her peak sales period

loans.name: Tiessiri 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe TIESSIRI 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N’TESSONI un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur sixième prêt de production de maïs  avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur SINALY débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  TIESSIRI 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 16 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 30 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  4 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 300 0000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
NB/ Monsieur DAOUDA n’était pas présent lors de la prise des photos pour des raisons sociales.
texts.en:
The six members of the group TIESSIRI 1 are married men who average 42 years of age and 8 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in N’TESSONI, a village located in the commune of LOBOUGOULA, in the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 6th time partnering with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mr. SINALY grows maize. He is the member standing in the center of the group photo. He will use his loan to buy 16 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 30 jugs of various grades of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 4 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mr. Sinaly expects to earn an average profit of 300,000 FCFA per campaign, which will allow him to repay his loan and the interest, and also to cover part of his family’s day-to-day expenses.

For social reasons, Mr. DAOUDA could not be present when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Bakir

texts.en:
Bakir, a 32-year-old refugee, is a widower who lives with his son in an IDP settlement. Bakir has a garden and earns money raising and selling seasonal fruits at the local bazaar. He has good skills, having worked in this area for seven years, and his monthly income is 170AZN. 

The raising of seasonal fruits is widespread in Azerbaijan because of high demand. People use fruits to make juice, jam, fruit pies and fruit cocktails. People attend Bakir’s grocery because his produce is always fresh and tasty. 

Bakir has had a hard life. He needs money to pay for his son’s education and cover living expenses. He has applied for a 600AZN loan in order to buy good fertilizers and vegetable seeds. In addition to growing fruits, Bakier plans to raise vegetables to increase the products he offers for sale. This will increase his monthly income. 

With a positive client history, this will be Bakir's fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy good fertilizers and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas to sell. He has been engaged in this business to make a living for more than seven years. He was able to expand his farm after taking his previous loan and has successfully repaid it with his generated income. Recently, he took a new loan to buy fertilizer. He plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers hairdressing services. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of beauty products. She hopes that in the future, she will be an independent person. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Christabel

texts.en: Christabel is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are frequent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have frequent cash flow.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose esta agradecido con el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de venta de abarrotes y pasamanería, como arroz  por sacos, conservas de pescado por caja, azúcar, entre otros, asi como también artículos como nylon, cuentas, entre otros para su negocio de pasamanería, ya que con los ingresos que le brindan su pequeño negocio el puede sacar adelante a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa y sus 2 hijos; asimismo trabaja como pescador, lo cual le brinda un ingreso extra; Jose es muy carismáticos y sobre todo es muy luchador ya que su gran sueño es:” Tener un minimarket y su casa propia”.
texts.en: Jose is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders provide, now that thanks to that he will be able to buy merchandise for his business of grocery sales and accessories for personal or office use, such as rice bags, boxes of canned fish, sugar, among other things as well, such as articles like nylon, beads, among other items for his business of personal or office accessories, now that with the earnings that his small business provides him he can get his family ahead, which is made up of his wife and two children. At the same time he works as a fisherman, which provides him an extra income. Jose is very charismatic and above all is very determined now that his great dream is: “to have a minimarket and his own house.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, tuna, among other things)

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a widowed mother and has seven children. She has a house of her own that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 
For the past four years, she has operated a fruit-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other fruits sellers. 
With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits at wholesale to resell at a profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits at wholesale to resell

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She keeps cattle and goats.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more goats and cattle for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cattle for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more foods to sell

loans.name: Dúo Azucena De Maria Group

texts.es: El duo esta formado por doña Maria Luisa de 62 años de edad quien se dedica al cultivo de flores y plantas para vender (vivero) lleva más de 20 años sembrando flores y venderlos en su comunidad, ella solicita su crédito para compra de material para elaborar un vivero (nailo, madera, alambre, abono, semilla, mano de obra ect.) ya que cuenta con 2 personas que le ayudan actualmente tiene gran demanda por sus clientes su mayor anhelo es poder incrementar sus ventas y ahorrar para su vejez y poder tener un mejor futuro para ella y su esposo.
texts.en: Maria Luisa is one of the members of this group. She is 62 years old and has worked in her community for over 20 years growing flowers and live plants to sell. She is requesting this loan to buy material to build a nursery, including plastic sheeting, wood, wire, manure and seeds, as well as to pay for the labor. Now that she has two people who help her, she has a lot more demand from her customers. Her greatest wish is to increase her sales and save for old age, so that she and her husband can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy material to build a nursery, including plastic sheeting, wood, wire, manure and seeds, as well as to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 32-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

He operates a construction business where he builds houses. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a developing area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the seasonal nature of the job. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy tools.

His business goal is to own his own construction company within five years. He hopes that in the future, his business income will be sufficient to sustain his family's needs. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his construction business.

loans.name: Shadia 1 Group

texts.en:
Zeina is the featured representative of the Shadia 1 group. She and the other group members have always been best friends. Their strong loyalty to each other has brought them to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in order to improve their financial situations.

Zeina is a 53-year-old widowed mother of five. Since her husband passed away, Zeina has been working hard to provide for her family and devote her attention to her children, since they have become her main source of hope in life. She has special cooking talents in which she invested during the past 10 years, preparing special meals and catering needs that are highly supportive of her family's needs.

Zeina now finds herself wanting to expand her business, but she can't afford to. Her loan from  Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in buying necessary business needs and raw materials that will help her grow her business. Zeina is the lady with the white top at the far right side of the picture, Ghina is standing next to her in the middle and Manal is on the far left.

loans.use: To buy necessary business needs and ingredients for catering

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married woman who has been blessed with four kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Biasha operates a fish-selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Biasha dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Nanda

texts.en:
Nanda is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman with eight children, seven of whom are in school and one is underage.

Nanda sells goat meat to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items like chips and mandazi

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be strong and determined. She operates an M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add M-pesa float (i.e. money for customers to withdraw). Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open another M-pesa shop. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float (i.e money for customers to withdraw)

loans.name: Buni

texts.en:
Buni is married with eight children, four of whom are in school and four are adults. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Buni has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past five years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel  de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, por lo limitado que era antes la educación no continua, ya que solo hasta ese grado había y la otra escuela quedaba en el pueblo, por lo que se le hacía imposible con las responsabilidades de la casa el seguir.  Se casó a la edad de los 24  años, a procreo tres  hijos con su pareja, quien se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa, dos de sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, solo la  niña de cinco años está con ellos.
