Darío es un hombre cuyas habilidades y aspiraciones la llevaron a ser una persona independiente el cual trabajo algunos años como ayudante de cerrajería pero tiempo después ya con los conocimientos y habilidades obtenidos opto por iniciar su propio negocio para administrarlo y guiarlo según sus propios criterios y gracias a este motivacional impulso de emprendimiento tiene su negocio operando hace aproximadamente 15 años.
Con 44 años de edad el cual sueña con hacer prosperar su negocio para mantenerse en la vejez tiene una querida familia constituida por su esposa y 3 hijos mayores de edad los cuales los tiene estudiando y paralelamente le colaboran con el negocio. Darío en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales, desde madera, metales entre otros para fabricar mayores objetos, desde puertas, ventanas, cocinas y estar un paso adelante cuando le salga un pedido poder tener los insumos a la mano y entregar la mercancía oportunamente
texts.en:
Darío is a man whose abilities and aspirations have elevated him to being an independent person. He worked a few years as an apprentice to a locksmith, and sometime later, with what he learned and the skills he obtained, decided to start his own business in order to be able to manage and guide it according to his own standards. Thanks to this motivational and entrepreneurial impulse, Darío has had his own business for approximately 15 years. 
At 44 years old, he dreams of making his business prosper so that he will be able to take care of himself in his old age. His dear family is composed of his wife and 3 adult children, all of whom are studying and helping with the business.
In search of better opportunities for his family, Darío requests a loan to purchase materials such as wood and metals in order to create a number of objects such as doors, windows and cabinets. This will put him a step ahead so that when he receives an order he will have the material on hand and be able to deliver the merchandise on time.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wood and metal.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sarin is a resident of Ponhea Krek district, located in Kampong Cham province. She is a 51-year-old, married woman and has five children. 

To sustain her family, she sows cassava seedlings for resale as the main source of income and she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This business generates her about KHR 31,900 per day. 

This is the second cycle for Sarin to request a microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. She has completely repaid the past loan and it allowed her to improve her living conditions. 

Now, she leads a group of two members to get a new loan of KHR 1,600,000 each. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer to use on her cassava. She hopes that she can get a higher yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chetra's Group

texts.en:
Chetra is living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is a 41-year-old farmer and the mother of nine children. Currently, eight of the children are dependent on her, and two are going to school. Chetra struggles to earn a living for the family by planting cassava, which she has done for about 23 years. Unfortunately, the agribusiness makes an average income for the whole family of only 30,600 KHR per day.

This is the second cycle for Chetra with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She repaid the past loan completely, and it has allowed her to improve her family situation. Now, she leads a group of four members to apply for a total loan amount of 4,800,000 KHR. Chetra's portion will be 1,300,000 KHR. As the loan is granted, she plans to use some of it to buy fertilizer and pesticide. Also, she will use the loan to play for land plowing and labor to collect the yield. She hopes that she will get a higher yield than before so that she will be able to upgrade the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for land plowing

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: juan de 44 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de frutas y verduras su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cebollas, tomates, papas, zanahorias, etc. por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Juan, of 44 years of age, has worked for several years selling fruits and vegetables. His business is located in a market near his house. With what he gets from his sales, he is able to pay for the household expenses. He lives in his own house with his life partner and his child. 

Juan is requesting a loan to buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, etc. in bulk, so he can continue with his sales, and give his family a better quality of life without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 40-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 12 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farming business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate income. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger and better business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Jeni

texts.en: Jeni is a forty-six-year-old woman, married with seven children; only five go to school. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a farmer of cocoa and has practiced it for thirteen years which has helped her to cater for her family's cost of living. She dreams of expanding her farming by buying a big piece of land that contains cocoa trees and yields more cocoa for supplying to big cocoa agents. Jeni is challenged by weather changes and wants a loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Mboze

texts.en:
This is Mboze. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sweets, milk, biscuits, rice and beans for resale. She appreciates Kiva  for their financial support. 

 She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, milk, biscuits, rice and beans for resale.

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en:
Khom, 53, is a resident of Cherng Prey district located in Kampong Cham province. She has five children, one of whom is in school. To cover the daily cost of living for her entire household, growing rice on two hectares' area is the main source of income for her family. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she and other two borrowers are in their  second cycle loan with successfully repayment of their first loan. The past loan allowed her to improve the situation of her family.

 Now, in this group of three, Khom is the leader. The total amount of her entire group loan is 4,500,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is her loan portion. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to plant her crop. She hopes that her agricultural business will provide a good yield and allow her to uplift her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to plant her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Chhreb's Group

texts.en:
A villager of Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, Chhreb is a 46-year-old mother of two children. The primary source of income for her family comes from a Krama weaving business, while the secondary source of income is from leasing loud speakers used during religious ceremonies. 

Chhreb is the leader of a group of two members. This is the first time either member has requested a microloan from Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The total loan for the group is 1,200,000 KHR, of which 400,000 KHR is Chhreb's portion. She plans to use the loan to renovate her house, buying zinc to be used as walls. She highly believes that her housing condition will be better than before.

loans.use: to buy zinc to repair her current house

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Somarch's Group

texts.en:
Somarch is a 26-year-old farmer, living in the Dambae  district located in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two little children who are dependent on her. She struggles to earn a living to support the family by engaging in agricultural business. Somarch has been planting cassava for sale for about six years already. 

Somarch is the leader of a group of three borrowers. She and her other two group members are requesting an equal loan share of 1,000,000 KHR each. Somarch will use a portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide to use on her cassava plantation. She plans to use another portion to pay for labor fees. She hopes that the yield will be good and will be sold at a desired price so that she can afford to rent an additional plot of land to expand the plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide  and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Tiessiri 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe TIESSIRI 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N'TESSONI un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur sixième prêt de production de maïs  avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur NOUHOUM débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  TIESSIRI 2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 15 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145 0000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the group TIESSIRI 2 are married men who average 46 years of age and 8 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in N’TESSONI, a village in the commune of LOBOUGOULA, in the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 6th time partnering with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mr. NOUHOUM grows maize. He is the member standing in the center of the group photo. He will use his loan to buy 8 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 15 jugs of various grades of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 2 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mr. Nouhoum expects to earn an average profit of 145,000 FCFA per campaign, which will allow him to repay his loan and the interest, and also to cover part of his family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Neris Estenia

texts.es:
Neris de 23 años de edad, estudio un nivel académico de bachiller, esta soltera y nadie depende de ella.

La cliente se dedica al negocio de hamacas hace seis años, aprendió de sus padres, pero el crédito ella lo necesita para la siembre de granos básicos.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para pagar mano de obra para el cultivo y la otra parte lo invertirá en la compra de dos quintales de abono y dos de sulfato para tener una buena cosecha.


El sueño de ella en el futuro es tener una familia y también seguir ayudando a sus padres, las ganancias de su negocio las invierte en la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Neris is 23 years old. She studied through college and is now single and living without dependents. For the past six year she has worked as a hammock maker, a trade which she learned from her parents. But the loan she requests is to plant basic crops. The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to pay laborers to help with with the crop, and to invest in the purchase of 200 kilos of compost and 200 kilos of sulfate which will improve the harvest.
Neris' dream is to have a family one day and also to continue supporting her parents - she spends the money she earns through her business to feed her family.

loans.use: to pay workers to hep with the harvest and to purchase compost and sulfate.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz amparo es una admirable madre cabeza de hogar la cual tuvo que criar a 3 hijos ella sola, se dedica a la venta de leche y tiene su vacas en la grande de sus padres donde actualmente vive y les paga un pequeño arriendo por el pasto y terreno que ocupan sus vacas. 
Gracias a sus amados animales ha logrado mantener a su 3 hijos y se enorgullece decir que nunca les ha faltado nada, en busca de mejorar sus condiciones, y mirando que sus hijos ya se acercan a una edad  para asistir a un universidad, requiere de una ayuda crediticia para la compra de dos vacas lecheras para aumentar su surtido lo que significaría un trabajo extra para ella pero no es de importancia si el resultado es ver a sus hijos recibiendo una buena educación y proyectándose como grandes profesionales
texts.en:
Luz Amparo is an admirable mother and head of household who has had to raise her 3 children by herself. She works selling milk and keeps her cows on land that belongs to her parents, where she also lives. She pays her parents a small amount of rent for the land and for the pasture where her cows graze.
Thanks to her beloved animals she has been able to support her three children, and she is proud to say that they have never wanted for anything. Looking to improve their situation, and seeing that her children are getting close to the age at which they could go to college, she needs a loan to buy two dairy cows in order to increase her supplies. It will mean extra work for her but this is not important if it means that she will see her children get a good education and go on to become successful in their professions.

loans.use: buy two dairy cows to increase her earnings and be able to pay for her children to go to college.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin de 38 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la reparación de refrigeradoras y demás electrodomésticos,tiene mucha clientela por su buen trabajo y los precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Martin esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos para electrodomésticos por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia o que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Martin is 38 years old and for many years he has repaired refrigerators and other electronic appliances. He has many clients thanks to his good work and accessible prices. With what he earns from his work he is able to cover some of the expenses of his household. He lives in his own home with his wife and two of their children. Martin is requesting a loan to purchase replacement parts, in bulk, for home electronics. This will allow him to continue his work and thereby provide for his family without any limitation.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts for home electronics.

loans.name: Toulas' Group

texts.en:
Toulas is living in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province.He is single and struggles to earn a living by cassava planting. He also works for the local to earn extra income. On a daily basis, Toulas can earn an average of 29,800 KHR to cover the basic daily needs of his household. 

He has been with Kiva's partner VisionFund for the past cycle and has repaid his past loan completely. 

Now, he is the leader of a group that consists of two members. The group requests a loan of 2,500,000 KHR, of which 1,500,000 KHR will belong to Toulas. He will use a portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for his cassava and another portion to renovate his house. 

He is hopeful that the yield of cassava will be higher and he will also able to have a proper house to shelter in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to repair his house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Oscar Enrique

texts.es: Oscar de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz desde hace 25 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ,logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Oscar esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar su terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y así continuar con su trabajo para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 36 year old Oscar lives in his own house with his wife and son. He has worked in agriculture, planting corn for 25 years. He markets his products outskirts of the area, which is how he makes his sales, and he has been able to pay off some household expenses. Oscar is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and to improve his land which is shown in the photo. With this, he will be able to continue with his work to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and to improve his land

loans.name: Tiessiri 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe TIESSIRI 3 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N’TESSONI un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur sixième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur DAOUDA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  TIESSIRI 3. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 15 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145 0000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the group TIESSIRI 3 are married men who average 41 years of age and 7 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in N’TESSONI, a village in the commune of LOBOUGOULA, in the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 6th time partnering with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mr. DAOUDA grows maize. He is the member standing first from the left in the group photo. He will use his loan to buy 8 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 15 jugs of various grades of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 2 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mr. Daouda expects to earn an average profit of 145,000 FCFA per campaign, which will allow him to repay his loan and the interest, and also to cover part of his family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Felicito Cristino

texts.es: felicito de 42 años de edad se dedica desde hace 2 años al cultivo de plátanos, cuando su cultivo ya esta listo lo comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside ya tiene clientela establecida que lo prefieren por los precios y la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con esposa y sus tres hijos, felicito esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, controles de plagas, abonos, etc. para poder seguir con sus cultivos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felicito is 42 years old, and he has worked growing bananas for over two years. When his harvest is ready, he sells it in the areas outside of where he lives. He has an established clientele that always buys from him because of his prices and his product's quality. With what he gets from the sales, he is able to straighten out some of his home expenses. He lives in his own house with his wife and three children.

Felicito is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, manure, etc. to be able to continue with his harvests, and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and manure.

loans.name: Wendy Yolanda

texts.es:
Wendy de 19 años de edad, solo estudio cuarto grado y luego se acompañó, el esposo es seguridad y actualmente están esperando su primer hijo.

Wendy se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de artículos de primera necesidad y granos básicos tiene dos años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual es un trabajo que su madre le enseño,  porque ella también se dedicaba  a ese negocio.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar arroz, maíz, frijole, pan, leche, bebidas, etc. para surtir su tienda y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias para mejor la calidad de vida de su familia.


Su sueño es ver más grande y surtido su negocio, para obtener mejores ganancias y poder comprar accesorios necesarios para la llegada de su hijo y poder darles una mejor calidad de vida, y solo lo puedo hacer con la ayuda de Dios y de los créditos de credicampo.
texts.en:
Wendy is 19 years old. She only studied through fourth grade and then later she entered into a common-law relationship. Her husband works in security, and they are currently expecting their first child.

Wendy works purchasing and selling basic goods and basic grains, and she has been working in this business for two years. Her mother taught her this work, because she also worked in the business. 

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to purchase rice, corn, beans, bread, milk and drinks to stock her store and to better serve to her clients so that she can earn a better income to improve her family's quality of life.

Her dream is to see her business grow and be better stocked, to earn a higher income, to be able to purchase the necessary accessories for her child's arrival, and to give them a better quality of life. She can only do this with the help of God and with the CrediCampo loans.

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn, beans, bread, milk, and drinks.

loans.name: Ascencion De Jesus

texts.es:
Ascensión es de los hombres que siempre están buscando lo mejor para su familia y el sostenimiento efectivo de su pequeño hijo de 9 años.
El ha sido agricultor toda su vida, pero hoy en día desea iniciar con un proyecto que consiste en la construcción de un parqueadero y lavadero de carros y motos en el municipio de Valencia, Córdoba.
Su esposa es una de las más entusiastas con esta nueva idea y por eso le brinda todo el apoyo a su esposo.
El desea un apoyo económico para terminar de construir su establecimiento y comenzar a obtener rentabilidad de este.
El seguirá trabajando en sus cultivos y alternara con la administración del parqueadero.
Esto le permitirá obtener los recursos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Ascensión is one of those men who is always searching for the best for his family and monetary support for his small son, aged 9. He has been a farmer all his life. Today, he wishes to start a project that consists of constructing a parking lot and carwash for cars and motorcycles in the town of Valencia, Córdoba.

His wife is one of the most enthusiastic people with this new idea, thus, she is giving all of her support to her husband. He will continue working at the crops and will alternate with managing the parking lot. This will allow him to obtain the necessary economic resources to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to construct a parking lot and carwash for cars and motorcycles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires to ensure the safety of his passengers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plants

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado con ayuda de sus padres;  pero  después empezó el bachillerato nocturno, porque en el día trabaja para costearse sus estudios y logro sacar el bachillerato.

 Ella es madre soltera  de dos hijos,   ellos están en la escuela el de 6 años en kinder y el otro en segundo grado,  la casa donde ella vive es de la mamá y con ella vive su hermana y los dos hijos de su hermana

María trabaja de secretaria en una óptica desde hace un año,  antes se dedicaba a un pequeño negocio que tenía con su hermana.  Ella se transporta en  autobús al trabajo se tarda como 25 minutos y su horario es de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm
 
El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para reparar el techo de la casa que lo tiene bien deteriorado y debido a que ha comenzado la temporada lluviosa  necesita reparar el techo.

Su deseo es tener  su casa  propia,  sabe que con esfuerzo y lucha cada día lo lograra y con la ayuda de Dios y de crediacampo con la oportunidad que brinda con el préstamo.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old. She studied through 9th grade with the help from her family. Afterwards she began going to night school because during the day she worked to finance her studies, and in this way she managed to receive her diploma. 
She is a single mother of two children, both of whom are in school, one is 6 years old and in kindergarten and the other is in second grade. They live in María's mother's home along with her sister and her sister's two sons. 
For the past year she has worked as a secretary for an optometrist. Before that she and her sister ran a small business together. María works 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. and gets to work by bus, which takes 25 minutes.
The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to repair the roof of her home which has really deteriorated. The rainy season has started so she needs to repair the roof. Her dream is to own her own home. She knows that her effort and strife, as well as the the help of God and of CREDICAMPO, which has issued this loan, will help her achieve this goal.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house which she needs to fix for the rainy season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 37, lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her resturant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a fridge and TV for the bar and will help Rose to generate greater profits and construct rentals. Rose hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start up a bar business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program.  This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and TV for the bar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards. That loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks and sugar. 

She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks and sugar

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary is a resident of Dambe district, located in Kampong Cham province. She is a 46-year-old mother with six children, two of whom are in school. 

The family's primary source of income comes from a cassava plantation. Nary has been planting cassava to earn a living for her family for about 28 years. The average income for the family is only 33,300 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

Nary has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for the past two cycles and has successfully repaid her past loan. The loan allowed her to uplift her living condition at a gradual pace. 

Now, she leads a group of five borrowers in a request for a loan of 3,400,000 KHR, from which her portion is 1,000,000 KHR. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and also to pay for labour fees for plowing the land and collecting the yield. 

She hopes that she will be able to have enough money to expand the plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labour fees

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of them is currently in school. For the past four years, Lucy has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells shoes and suitcases. 

To help expand her business, Lucy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more suitcases and will help Lucy generate greater profits and expand on the business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to increase profits. 

Lucy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lucy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more suitcases.

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en:
Edreda is 38 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, who are both currently in school. For the past 11 years, Edreda has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells broilers, eggs, and layers. 

To help expand her business, Edreda has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy poultry feeds, drinkers, and food and will help Edreda to generate greater profits and expand her business. Edreda hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big farm. 

Edreda is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edreda, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds, drinkers, and food for her poultry farm.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past three years, David has been working hard to manage his electronic shop, which sells electronic items.To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy flat irons, a computer, and mobile phones, and will help David to generate greater profits and increase the stocks. David hopes that in the future he will be able to out compete other suppliers. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy flat irons, a computer, and mobile phones.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past six years, Norah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells grocery items. To help expand her business, Norah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy household items and a popcorn machine, and will help Norah to generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living. Norah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a better life. 

Norah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Norah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy household items and a popcorn machine.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 46 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her welding business, which deals in welding doors. 

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more metals and will help Hellen to generate greater profits and expand her customer base. Hellen hopes that in the future, she will be able to have efficient operations. 

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hellen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more metal for welding

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a 25-year-old male, and married with three children living in Bundibugyo Uganda. He is a cocoa farmer who started the business seven years ago. He loves to take good care of his family and decided to buy a motorcycle for a transport business to supplement his income. He hopes to buy land and grow more cocoa in addition to renting many cocoa gardens, because of the good profits he gets.  However, capital and thieves hinder his business expectations.  Eric is accessing a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Rufat

texts.en:
Rufat is 25 years old. He is an IDP from Fuzuli city, now is living in Bala Bahmanli village. Rufat is married and father of two juvenile children. 

Previously he took a loan for his retail business.  Two years ago he started his second business, so that he has been in animal breeding business in his courtyard area for two years. Rufat wants to support his new business and for that he needs a loan in amount of 1000 Azerbaijan New Manat. With this amount, Rufat is planning buy more lambs. He gives great thanks for two loans from the Kiva organization.

loans.use: buy more lambs

loans.name: Saxavat

texts.en: Saxavat is 28 years old, married and has a daughter who is going to kindergarten. Saxavat is an IDP-Internally Displaced Person, from Fuzuli city. Today he lives with his lovely family in Fuzuli region-Aybasanli village. Saxavat has been in the animal breeding business for 10 years. He learned this profession from his father and his wife helps him. They make and sell different dairy products from milk, and also deal with the sale of meat. Today, to increase the family business, Saxavat needs a loan of 1,300 AZN. With this loan he wants to buy little calves, raise them, and improve his business.  He says he is greatly thankful to Kiva organization and lenders for this help.

loans.use: to buy little calves.

loans.name: Madline

texts.en:
Madline is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Madline has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes and baby items. 

To help expand her business, Madline has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Madline to generate greater profits and increase her capital base. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Madline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Madline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more clothes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 23 años de edad vive en casa del tío con el, desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de la casa, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes,abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos, y asi tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The 23-year-old client lives with his uncle in his uncle´s house. For several years, he has been making a living in agriculture. His principal crops are corn and beans. He sells his products in the different markets located around his residence. He helps with the home expenses with what he earns from his sales. 

The client is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, compost, pesticide, herbicide, etc. to improve the land shown in the photograph, in order to be able to continue planting his crops and that way, have more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pesticide, herbicide, etc. and improve the land

loans.name: Nader Group

texts.en:
May is the featured borrower of the Nader group; she joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

May is a 58-year-old single lady, the sole breadwinner for herself and two other members of her family, whom she works hard to provide with living needs. She has been working in the handicraft business from her house for a long time, while at the same time she has been employed in a  social services company for six years, to make sure that her combined income will help her support her family properly.

Today, May's acquired loan will be invested in buying necessary threads, needles, and decorating items newly released that will attract customers' attention. May is the lady sitting at the far left side of the picture, Roueida is sitting at the center of the picture, while Saraa is the lady sitting at the far right side of the picture.

loans.use: to buy necessary threads, needles, and decorating items newly released that will attract customers' attention

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 26-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He is the father of two sons and one daughter. For the past two years, Haytham has been working in a store selling laptops and their accessories. It is a good business and the only one in his area. 

Haytham has taken out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more items for his laptop store to resell. By taking out this loan, Haytham will be able to improve the store and increase sales.
 
Haytham appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more items for his laptop store to resell.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Robina has been working hard to manage her cosmetic shop, which sells cosmetic items. 

To help expand her business, Robina has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetic items, and will help Robina to generate greater profits and buy a plot of land. Robina hopes that in the future she will be able to start up another branch. 

Robina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more cosmetic items

loans.name: Lourdes Esperanza

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 46 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su hijo quien es su mayor orgullo y por quien ha luchado constantemente para sacarlo adelante.
Al ser madre soltera tuvo que salir a trabajar para poder brindarle una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo quien hoy es un gran profesional y una excelente persona gracias al apoyo que recibió de Lourdes.
Desde hace más de 2 años trabaja en un restaurante como cocinera, le va muy bien porque es una persona que siempre le pone pasión a todo lo que hace, y sobre todo porque sus platillos son excelentes y deliciosos.
Lourdes está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá remodelar su vivienda, colocará lunas y puertas en el segundo piso para que así pueda sentir mayor seguridad y comodidad y elevar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 46 years old and lives in Ica with her son, who is her greatest source of pride and for whom she has fought constantly in order to get him ahead. Being a single mother, she had to go out and work in order to offer her son a good education and a better quality of life. Today, he is a great professional and an excellent person, thanks to the support he received from Lourdes.

She has worked as a chef in a restaurant for more than two years. It is going very well for her because she is a person who always puts passion into everything she does, and especially because her plates are excellent and delicious.

Lourdes is thankful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support they have offered her, she will be able to remodel her home, placing doors and sliding glass windows on the second floor so that she can feel more secure and comfortable, and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: remodel her home (place doors and sliding glass windows on the second floor of her house)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stocks.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Ran, a resident of the Tbaung Khmum district in Kampong Cham province, is a 48-year-old married mother of seven children, four of whom are dependent on her. Ran struggles to earn money to support her family by growing cassava. Engaged in this agribusiness for about 18 years, she earns an average income of 31,900 KHR per day. 

Ran is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 KHR for her group of two; each member's share will be 1,400,000 KHR. Ran will use her portion to pay for cassava trees, fertilizers and labor fees. She believes the loan will enable her to achieve a good yield so that she can better support her family and place her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for cassava trees, fertilizer and labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a57-year-old married man with four children who all go to school. They live in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer and grows mainly cocoa. He has practiced this for 17 years and has managed to maintain the welfare of his family and meet some daily expenses. He dreams of expanding his farming by buying a big piece of land that contains cocoa so he can harvest more cocoa to sell to cocoa agents. He is challenged by unpredictable weather changes. Steven will use the loan to buy cocoa and rent cocoa gardens to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and rent cocoa gardens to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 47 years old and single. She has been in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, for the past year. 

Edina has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

In the future, Edina would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 38 years old, and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Micheal has been working hard to manage his drug business, which deals in human drugs.  To help expand his business, Micheal has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, and will help Micheal to generate greater profits and expand on the business. Micheal hopes that in the future, he will be able to become a wholesaler. 

Micheal is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Micheal who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for his business.

loans.name: Sulaiti

texts.en:
Sulaiti is 35 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Sulaiti has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells household commodities.  To help expand his business, Sulaiti has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more groceries like detergent, books, oil, and soda, and will help Sulaiti to generate greater profits and have a bigger business. Sulaiti hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand on the business. 

Sulaiti is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sulaiti who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like detergent, books, oil, and soda.

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en:
Bayram is 57 years old, is married and has two sons and one daughter. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. Bayram has bred cattle for the past 25 years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his own business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.

Bayram usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then sells them for a profit at the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is  220 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. He also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling milk products to neighbours. 

Bayram has already taken out loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase one beef cow and one milk cow. With this money, he wants to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one beef cow and one milk cow

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 39 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past four years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, where she sells spare parts. To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy tires, tubes, and oil, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and increase stocks. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to have enough stock. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Faridah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy tires, tubes, and oil to increase her stocks.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a 65-year-old male married with seven children, only two of whom go to school. They live in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Vicent is a farmer who grows mainly cocoa and has been practising this since 1994. Using the proceeds, he has managed to maintain the welfare of his family. 

Vicent dreams of becoming a leading cocoa producer in his area. His goal is to have an income base and to live a good old age. Like other cocoa farmers, he complains of seasonal weather changes. Vicent will use the loan to rent a cocoa garden to harvest cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To rent a cocoa garden to harvest cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Joselita

texts.en: Joselita is 50 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Joselita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle. Joselita has been raising cattle for five years, and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 39 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elenita has been in this business for the past eight years and earns additional income from selling sand and gravel.

Elenita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila, a villager in her early fifties, wants to buy a cow and a calf and she needs your financial help. An amount of 250,000 Albanian Lek that she is seeking from you will be enough to achieve her goal. Agriculture/livestock has been the only source of income for their family of four including two children in their early 20s. She wants to add more animals to the herd, to increase the family's income and pay for her children's university tuition fees.
 
In addition to the livestock, Dila plants wheat, corn and seasonal vegetables: all of these are for family use and to feed her animals. She also makes and sells trachanas, made with dried wheat flour and yoghurt, and home-made spaghetti, called ‘jufka’in the local language, made with wheat flour, eggs and milk.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and a calf to increase her herd

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married mother of six children, all of whom go to school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Asha has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Asha dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. Asha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Farhad

texts.en: Farhad is 41 years old, and married with a child. His child goes to school and his wife is a nurse at a local polyclinic. Farhad’s family is living at Alixanli village of Fuzuli region, but for 21 years they have been IDP, (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Farhad has been in the animal breeding business. At present, he needs a loan in the amount of 1,300 AZN. For this reason, Farhad has applied to Komak company. With this loan he wants to build a small stall for cows. He says he is greatly thankful to Kiva organization and lenders for the help. In the future, Farhad wants to give a good education to his child.

loans.use: to build a small stall for cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more natural oils for his store.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam operates a fish-selling business to earn a living,  She faces the major challenges of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, Mariam wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future. 

Mariam appreciates the support of the previous loan that helped her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Roula

texts.en:
Roula is a 40-year-old married mother of four, who has been working as a beauty specialist and provides special facial treatment services from her house. She has 20 years of experience in this domain, and is well known in her region and recommended by most of her clients.

Today, Roula is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy special accessories for her business, in addition to newly released summer cosmetics. She is aware that this loan will support her business development, as she has had experience with two previous loans from Al Majmoua. These were also invested in her business development and helped her in supporting her beloved husband to cover most of their family's needs.

Roula hopes to open her own separate beauty salon as soon as possible to provide her customers and family members with the necessary privacy that they deserve.

loans.use: To buy special accessories for her business, in addition to newly released summer cosmetics

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 32 years old, and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Stephen has been working hard to manage his butcher shop, which sells meat. To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more meat, and will help Stephen to generate greater profits and create more labor. Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to make more profits. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stephen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more meat for his business.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 21-year-old, single man from Khanyounis. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Mustafa has worked in his barbershop for the past three years. He has very good experience in this field. His store located in a very good area in the city and he has his local clients. Mustafa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new chair for his barbershop. By taking this loan, Mustafa will be able to improve his store. He would like to take a bigger loan in the future and expand the store. 
Mustafa appears in the photo in his barbershop.

loans.use: to buy a new chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is the mother of two and runs a business in one of Nairobi's busy markets. As she was going about her daily routine one day, she noticed that the marketplace in which she works had very few and unreliable sanitation facilities. Jane also noticed that there were a few people running Fresh Life sanitation facilities at the market. 

Jane approached one of them who explained how the Fresh Life model works. Impressed by the standards of cleanliness at the facility, she thought it would be a good investment. Jane seeks a loan to help her purchase two Fresh Life toilets in order to make sanitation facilities easily available at the market. She hopes that her franchise will be successful enabling her to purchase more toilets as well as to repay her loan.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Gloria Eugenia

texts.es: Gloria una mujer cuyos allegados la destacan como una persona  emprendedora, luchadora, motivadora y ante todo con sus objetivos bien claro, es una mujer con una situación sentimental de separada vela incansablemente pro su hijo de 20 años de edad, pues quiere que tenga la educación y comodidades que ella en una juventud no pudo tener, laboralmente trabajo varios años en tiendas clandestinas y hace 4 años monto su propio negocio el cual lo tiene ubicado en un sector donde muchos automóviles y viajeros  desembarcan para tomar algo o comprar algunos víveres, en busca de ofrecer un mejorar su servicio y viendo un caso en particular que se presenta muy seguido el cual es que los conductores llegan pidiendo un servicio de monta llantas, quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra   de todo el equipo de monta llantas para vehículos pesados y medios lo cual mejoraría su negocio y sería de gran ayuda para todos los transeúntes que pasan por su tienda.
texts.en:
Gloria is a woman whose relatives distinguish her as an entrepreneurial, motivating person, a fighter, and above all, very clear with her objectives. Her relationship status is separated, and she cares tirelessly for her 20-year-old son, since she wants him to have the education and comforts that she could not have in her youth. 

Occupationally, she worked for several years in underground stores, and four years ago she started her own business, which is located in a sector where many automobiles and travelers disembark in order to eat or drink something, or buy some provisions. 

In an effort to offer better services, and having seen a particular need that comes up very often, which is that drivers arrive requesting a tire mounting service, she wants to ask for a loan for the purchase of the entire tire mounting set for medium-sized and heavy vehicles. This will improve her business, and would be of great help to all of the passers-by who pass through her store.

loans.use: buy a whole tool set so she can set up a tire mounter in her business and improve her store´s service

loans.name: Baxtiyar

texts.en:
Baxtiyar is 58 years old and is married with two sons. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives in Bilasuvar with his family. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Baxtiyar has 10 years of experience in this field, and the reason which pushed him to start his own business was a very low pension.

Baxtiyar usually buys calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yoghurt to neighbours. Selling milk and meat brings an income of 150 AZN per month. 

Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also present in everyday life. 

Baxtiyar has applied for a loan of 800 AZN to purchase  two milking cows. This will be his third loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase two milking cows

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  BENKADI 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur septième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur FATOGOMA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme   BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 16 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 30 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  4 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 300 0000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkadi 1 group are married men averaging 40 years of age, with at least seven children each. They live mainly in traditional families in Kolokoba, a township in the District of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mail.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural businesses during the rainy season.
They are on their seventh agricultural loan taken out to grow corn. Their prior loans with Soro Yiriwaso have been duly repaid. They grow corn, which is what Mr. Fatogoma does, for example. He is the second one standing from left to right in the group photo.
With his loan, he plans to buy 16 50-kg -110 lbs] bags of fertilizers, 30 jugs of various herbicides and pay the cost of labor to work four ha [10 acres] of land. 

After harvesting, he sells his produce at  his village and in Sikasso, to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit.
He plans to earn an average  revenue of 300,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle.
This revenue will allow him to pay off his loan with interest and use the rest toward everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is 32 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Scola has been working hard to manage her bar. . 

To help expand her business, Scola has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spirits, water, beer, and sodas and will help Scola to generate greater profits and expand the business. Scola hopes that in the future, she will be able to help build her family. 

Scola is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Scola who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy spirits, water, beer, and sodas

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANTANSO dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA  dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec madame ROKIA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 63.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the BENKADI 1 group are married women and they are, on average, 38 years old with two children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Niantanso, a village located in the commune of Lobougoula, Cercle of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).  They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.  They are on their eighth loan with the institution, and their previous loans have been duly repaid. 

Rokia, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the left.  She is planning to use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizers, one can of herbicide, and also to cover the cost of plowing on 0.5 hectare of land.  After the harvest, she sells her crops in her village and in Sikasso.  Her customers are both men and women and they pay her in cash and on credit.  Rokia is expecting to make an average profit of 63,000 CFA francs per planting season.   She will use this profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has five children with two of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her tailoring business in which she sews clothing.

To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials and threads and will help Elizabeth to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Elizabeth hopes that in the future, she will be able to have quality materials. 

Elizabeth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Elizabeth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy materials and threads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items for his clothing and cosmetics store to resell.

loans.name: Bashkim

texts.en:
Bashkim, one of KosInvest's loyal clients, is asking for a Kiva loan for the third time for his hamburger business. He was been very satisfied with the previous loans he has received which have helped him to generate more income for his family. Bashkim is still involved in his same hamburger business and continues to see much success. 

However, Bashkim is again in need of a loan so that he can purchase meat and a new umbrella to replace the one damaged by snow and rain during winter. He promises to pay on time and would like to thank all of the Kiva lenders for their support a third time.

loans.use: To purchase meat and a new umbrella to replace the one damaged by snow and rain during winter

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, aged 40, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school.. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Flora has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past five years. 

Flora has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Flora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been in the pig-fattening business for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
Jasoda, the lady sitting in front with her hand raised in the photograph is a young and active married woman who is 28 years old. She is a permanent resident of Hatibandha village in Nuapada district in Odisha, India. She hails from a business class family. She resides with her husband and two children. Her children are studying in a private school in her village.
  
Jasoda has been running a computer center with a photo copier and photo studio in her village with the help of her husband for the last nine years. Presently, she is earning a monthly income of 10,000 INR. With this small income, Jasoda can hardly manage her family's expenses along with her business investment and the educational expenses of her children. Prior to the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation, Jasoda was in search of a credit source to expand her business to meet her financial needs. When Mahashakti started working in her village, she motivated nine other women from her locality and formed a Self Help Group named Maa Mangala to take a loan for the development of their businesses. Jasoda herself took a loan of 16,000 INR to purchase a new photocopy machine for quality service to her customers. Jasoda hopes this investment will definitely help her to increase her income. With this vision, she hopes to give better higher education to her children, as now they are at the primary school stage. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a digital video camera. 

The other nine members of the group are running a tailoring center, a betel shop, a computer and courier service, a Tiffin stall, vending vegetables, etc.

loans.use: To purchase a new photocopy machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nabat

texts.en:
Nabat is a 53-year-old refugee. She is married and has a daughter and a son. Her husband is a labourer and the family has lived in an IDP (internally displaced person) settlement for a long time. Nabat earns money working in her small shop business. She sells household goods (plates, knives, metalware, glasses, cups, shampoo, washing powder, soaps, etc.). She has been working in this area for 30 years and her monthly income is 180 AZN.

Selling household goods is very useful because people buy everything there that they need for everyday life. Local people prefer to attend Nabat’s shop because she is very kind and friendly and tries to sell as cheaply as possible. She knows that it’s hard for refugees to get money and buy something.
 
Nabat applied for a loan of 1000 AZN in order to buy other kinds of goods so she can diversify the assortment of goods in her shop. She plans to sell more goods and increase her income. Nabat needs money in order to rebuild her shop because it’s very old and in bad condition.

loans.use: to buy other kinds of goods to diversify the assortment of goods in her shop

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 45 years old and lives in the town of Lira in the Soroti region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with four of them currently in school. For the past fivw years, Mike has been working hard to manage his agriculture produce business, which deals in produce. 

To help expand his business, Mike has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beans, rice, groundnuts, and soya beans, and will help Mike to generate greater profits and expand the business. Mike hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another outlet. 

Mike is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mike who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy beans, rice, groundnuts, and soya beans

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past five years, Annah has been working hard to manage her beauty salon business. 

To help expand her business, Annah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chemicals and weaves and will help Annah to generate greater profits and set standards. Annah hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Annah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and hair weaves

loans.name: Ignatius

texts.en:
Ignatius is 28 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past five years, Ignatius has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells household commodities. 

To help expand his business, Ignatius has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, posho, oil, sodas, juice, mineral water, bread, sweets, soap, and detergent, and will help Ignatius to generate greater profits. Ignatius hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Ignatius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ignatius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy sugar, posho, oil, sodas, juice, mineral water, bread, sweets, soap and detergent

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, ont en moyenne 9 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur septième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur SEKOU débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme   BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 16 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 30 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  4 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 300 0000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the BENKADI 2 group are married men and they are, on average, 44 years old with nine children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Kolokoba, a commune located in the Cercle of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh maize production loan with the institution, and have duly repaid their previous loans. 

Sekou, a member of the group, grows maize. In the photo, he is in the standing row, first from the left. He is planning to use his loan to buy sixteen 50-kilo bags of fertilizers, 30 cans of various herbicides, and also to cover the cost of plowing on four hectares of land. After the harvest, he sells his crops in his village and in Sikasso. His customers are both men and women and they pay him in cash and on credit. Sekou is expecting to make an average profit of 300,000 CFA francs per planting season. He will use part of this profit to repay his loan and the interest, and the rest to cover some of the family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and to cover plowing costs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past four years.

Gemma has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and materials for her food vending business.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials for her food vending business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Helen has run a general store in the Philippines for the past five years and also earns an income from an internet cafe.

Helen has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, juice, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Helen aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coffee, juice, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Neema has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Neema dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and rice for sale. Neema decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and rice for sale

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with five children all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mejumaa wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason, with the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.
